Storage.description: The Storage module manages client-side data storage.
Storage.name: Storage

imageloader.description:
The ImageLoader Utility is a framework to dynamically load images according to certain triggers,
enabling faster load times and a more responsive UI.
imageloader.name: imageloader

event-delegate.description: Augments the Event Utility with a delegate method that facilitates easy creation of delegated event listeners. (Note: Using CSS selectors as the filtering criteria for delegated event listeners requires inclusion of the Selector Utility.)
event-delegate.title: Event Utility Event Delegation Module
event-delegate.name: event-delegate

calendar.description:
The Calendar component is a UI control that enables users to choose one or more dates from a graphical calendar presented in a one-month or
multi-month interface. Calendars are generated entirely via script and can be navigated without any page refreshes.
calendar.title: Calendar
calendar.name: calendar

event.description:
The Event Utility provides utilities for managing DOM Events and tools
for building event systems
event.title: Event Utility
event.name: event

datemath.description:
The datemath module provides utility methods for basic JavaScript Date object manipulation and 
comparison.
datemath.name: datemath

paginator.description:
The Paginator widget provides a set of controls to navigate through paged
data.
paginator.name: paginator

container.description:
The Container family of components is designed to enable developers to 
create different kinds of content-containing modules on the web. Module 
and Overlay are the most basic containers, and they can be used directly 
or extended to build custom containers. Also part of the Container family 
are four UI controls that extend Module and Overlay: Tooltip, Panel, 
Dialog, and SimpleDialog.
container.title: Container
container.name: container

stylesheet.description:
The StyleSheet component is a utility for managing css rules at the
stylesheet level
stylesheet.name: stylesheet

charts.description:
The Charts widget provides a Flash control for displaying data
graphically by series across A-grade browsers with Flash Player installed.
charts.title: Charts Widget
charts.name: charts

swf.description: The SWF utility is a tool for embedding Flash applications in HTMl pages.
swf.title: SWF Utility
swf.name: swf

json.description: Provides methods to parse JSON strings and convert objects to JSON strings.
json.name: json

animation.description: The animation module provides allows effects to be added to HTMLElements.
animation.name: animation

event-mouseenter.description:
Augments the Event Utility with support for the mouseenter and mouseleave 
events:  A mouseenter event fires the first time the mouse enters an 
element; a mouseleave event first the first time the mouse leaves an 
element.
event-mouseenter.title: Event Utility mouseenter and mouseout Module
event-mouseenter.name: event-mouseenter

dragdrop.description:
The drag and drop utility provides a framework for building drag and drop
applications.  In addition to enabling drag and drop for specific elements,
the drag and drop elements are tracked by the manager class, and the
interactions between the various elements are tracked during the drag and
the implementing code is notified about these important moments.
dragdrop.title: Drag and Drop
dragdrop.name: dragdrop

carousel.description:
The Carousel module provides a widget for browsing among a set of like
objects represented pictorially.
carousel.title: Carousel Widget
carousel.name: carousel

element-delegate.description: Augments the Element Utility with a delegate method that facilitates easy creation of delegated event listeners. (Note: Using CSS selectors as the filtering criteria for delegated event listeners requires inclusion of the Selector Utility.)
element-delegate.title: Element Event Delegation Module
element-delegate.name: element-delegate

logger.description:
The Logger widget provides a simple way to read or write log messages in
JavaScript code. Integration with the YUI Library's debug builds allow
implementers to access under-the-hood events, errors, and debugging messages.
Output may be read through a LogReader console and/or output to a browser
console.
logger.title: Logger Widget
logger.name: logger

editor.description: Creates a rich custom Toolbar Button. Primarily used with the Rich Text Editor's Toolbar
editor.name: editor

colorpicker.description: The colorpicker module provides a widget for selecting colors
colorpicker.name: colorpicker

imagecropper.requires: yahoo, dom, dragdrop, element, event, resize
imagecropper.name: imagecropper

get.description:
Provides a mechanism to fetch remote resources and
insert them into a document
get.name: get

yahoo.description:
The YAHOO object is the single global object used by YUI Library.  It
contains utility function for setting up namespaces, inheritance, and
logging.  YAHOO.util, YAHOO.widget, and YAHOO.example are namespaces
created automatically for and used by the library.
yahoo.title: YAHOO Global
yahoo.name: yahoo

selector.description: The selector module provides helper methods allowing CSS3 Selectors to be used with DOM elements.
selector.title: Selector Utility
selector.name: selector

slider.description:
The Slider component is a UI control that enables the user to adjust 
values in a finite range along one or two axes. Typically, the Slider 
control is used in a web application as a rich, visual replacement 
for an input box that takes a number as input. The Slider control can 
also easily accommodate a second dimension, providing x,y output for 
a selection point chosen from a rectangular region.
slider.title: Slider Widget
slider.name: slider

layout.description: Provides a fixed layout containing, top, bottom, left, right and center layout units. It can be applied to either the body or an element.
layout.name: layout

profilerviewer.description:
The ProfilerViewer module provides a graphical display for viewing
the output of the YUI Profiler <http://developer.yahoo.com/yui/profiler>.
profilerviewer.requires: yahoo, dom, event, element, profiler, yuiloader
profilerviewer.name: profilerviewer

datatable.description:
The DataTable widget provides a progressively enhanced DHTML control for
displaying tabular data across A-grade browsers.
datatable.title: DataTable Widget
datatable.name: datatable

swfstore.description: Provides a swf based storage implementation
swfstore.name: swfstore

yuiloader.description:
Provides dynamic loading for the YUI library.  It includes the dependency
info for the library, and will automatically pull in dependencies for
the modules requested.  It supports rollup files (such as utilities.js
and yahoo-dom-event.js), and will automatically use these when
appropriate in order to minimize the number of http connections
required to load all of the dependencies.
yuiloader.name: yuiloader

dom.description: The dom module provides helper methods for manipulating Dom elements.
dom.name: dom

tabview.description: The tabview module provides a widget for managing content bound to tabs.
tabview.name: tabview

button.description:
The Button Control enables the creation of rich, graphical buttons that function like traditional HTML form buttons. Unlike traditional HTML form buttons, buttons created with the Button Control can have a label that is different from its value. With the inclusion of the optional Menu Control, the Button Control can also be used to create menu buttons and split buttons, controls that are not available natively in HTML. The Button Control can also be thought of as a way to create more visually engaging implementations of the browser's default radio-button and check-box controls.

The Button Control supports the following types:

push
Basic push button that can execute a user-specified command when pressed.
link
Navigates to a specified url when pressed.
submit
Submits the parent form when pressed.
reset
Resets the parent form when pressed.
checkbox
Maintains a "checked" state that can be toggled on and off.
radio
Maintains a "checked" state that can be toggled on and off. Use with the ButtonGroup class to create a set of controls that are mutually exclusive; checking one button in the set will uncheck all others in the group.
menu
When pressed will show/hide a menu.
split
Can execute a user-specified command or display a menu when pressed.
button.title: Button
button.name: button

element.description:
Element provides an wrapper object to simplify adding
event listeners, using dom methods, and managing attributes.
element.name: element

autocomplete.description:
The AutoComplete control provides the front-end logic for text-entry suggestion and
completion functionality.
autocomplete.title: AutoComplete Widget
autocomplete.name: autocomplete

connection.description:
The Connection Manager provides a simplified interface to the XMLHttpRequest
object.  It handles cross-browser instantiantion of XMLHttpRequest, negotiates the
interactive states and server response, returning the results to a pre-defined
callback you create.
connection.name: connection

datasource.description:
The DataSource utility provides a common configurable interface for widgets to
access a variety of data, from JavaScript arrays to online database servers.
datasource.title: DataSource Utility
datasource.name: datasource

menu.description:
The Menu family of components features a collection of controls that make it easy to add menus to your website or web application. With the Menu Controls you can create website fly-out menus, customized context menus, or application-style menu bars with just a small amount of scripting.

The Menu family of controls features:

  • Keyboard and mouse navigation.
  • A rich event model that provides access to all of a menu's interesting moments.
  • Support for Progressive Enhancement; Menus can be created from simple, semantic markup on the page or purely through JavaScript.
menu.title: Menu
menu.name: menu

treeview.description: The treeview widget is a generic tree building tool.
treeview.title: TreeView Widget
treeview.name: treeview

history.title: Browser History Manager
history.name: history

YAHOO.widget.Panel.name: YAHOO.widget.Panel

keylisteners.description:
A KeyListener (or array of KeyListeners) that will be enabled 
when the Panel is shown, and disabled when the Panel is hidden.

draggable.description: Boolean specifying if the Panel should be draggable. The default value is "true" if the Drag and Drop utility is included, otherwise it is "false." PLEASE NOTE: There is a known issue in IE 6 (Strict Mode and Quirks Mode) and IE 7 (Quirks Mode) where Panels that either don't have a value set for their "width" configuration property, or their "width" configuration property is set to "auto" will only be draggable by placing the mouse on the text of the Panel's header element. To fix this bug, draggable Panels missing a value for their "width" configuration property, or whose "width" configuration property is set to "auto" will have it set to the value of their root HTML element's offsetWidth before they are made visible. The calculated width is then removed when the Panel is hidden. This fix is only applied to draggable Panels in IE 6 (Strict Mode and Quirks Mode) and IE 7 (Quirks Mode). For more information on this issue see: YUILibrary bugs #1726972 and #1589210.

dragOnly.description:
Boolean specifying if the draggable Panel should be drag only, not interacting with drop targets on the page.

When set to true, draggable Panels will not check to see if they are over drop targets, or fire the DragDrop events required to support drop target interaction (onDragEnter, onDragOver, onDragOut, onDragDrop etc.). If the Panel is not designed to be dropped on any target elements on the page, then this flag can be set to true to improve performance.

When set to false, all drop target related events will be fired.

The property is set to false by default to maintain backwards compatibility but should be set to true if drop target interaction is not required for the Panel, to improve performance.

modal.description:
True if the Panel should be displayed in a modal fashion, 
automatically creating a transparent mask over the document that
will not be removed until the Panel is dismissed.

close.description: True if the Panel should display a "close" button

underlay.description: Sets the type of underlay to display for the Panel. Valid values are "shadow," "matte," and "none". PLEASE NOTE: The creation of the underlay element is deferred until the Panel is initially made visible. For Gecko-based browsers on Mac OS X the underlay elment is always created as it is used as a shim to prevent Aqua scrollbars below a Panel instance from poking through it (See YUILibrary bug #1723530).

strings.default:
An object literal with the properties shown below:
close
String : The string to use for the close icon. Defaults to "Close".
strings.description: UI Strings used by the Panel

render.description:
Renders the Panel by inserting the elements that are not already in 
the main Panel into their correct places. Optionally appends the 
Panel to the specified node prior to the render's execution. NOTE: 
For Panels without existing markup, the appendToNode argument is 
REQUIRED. If this argument is ommitted and the current element is 
not present in the document, the function will return false, 
indicating that the render was a failure.

_doClose.description: Event handler for the close icon

stackMask.description:
Sets the zindex of the mask, if it exists, based on the zindex of the Panel element. The zindex of the mask is set to be one less than the Panel element's zindex.

NOTE: This method will not bump up the zindex of the Panel to ensure that the mask has a non-negative zindex. If you require the mask zindex to be 0 or higher, the zindex of the Panel should be set to a value higher than 0, before this method is called.

to enforce modality for browsers in which focus cannot

YAHOO.util.KeyListener.name: YAHOO.util.KeyListener
YAHOO.util.KeyListener.knownissue:
the "keypress" event is completely broken in Safari 2.x and below.
the workaround is use "keydown" for key listening.  However, if
it is desired to prevent the default behavior of the keystroke,
that can only be done on the keypress event.  This makes key
handling quite ugly.

YAHOO.widget.Toolbar.name: YAHOO.widget.Toolbar

disabled.description: Boolean indicating if the toolbar should be disabled. It will also disable the draggable attribute if it is on.

grouplabels.description: Boolean indicating if the toolbar should show the group label's text string.

collapse.description:
Boolean indicating if the the titlebar should have a collapse button.
The collapse button will not remove the toolbar, it will minimize it to the titlebar

buttonType.description: The buttonType to use (advanced or basic)

draggable.description: Boolean indicating if the toolbar should be draggable.

titlebar.description:
Boolean indicating if the toolbar should have a titlebar. If
passed a string, it will use that as the titlebar text

valueClick.description:
This is a special dynamic event that is created and dispatched based on the value property of the button config. See Element.addListener for more information on listening for this event. Example: 
buttons : [
{ type: 'button', value: 'test', value: 'testButton' }
]
 With the valueClick event you could subscribe to this buttons click event with this: tbar.in('testButtonClick', function() { alert('test button clicked'); })

YAHOO.widget.CellEditor.name: YAHOO.widget.CellEditor

params.name: sType
params.description: Type indicator, to map to YAHOO.widget.DataTable.Editors.

params.name: oConfigs
params.description: (Optional) Object literal of configs.

constructors.description: Factory class for instantiating a BaseCellEditor subclass.

YAHOO.widget.CellEditor.description: Factory class for instantiating a BaseCellEditor subclass.

maxX.description: The max x coord of the element

maxY.description: The max y coord of the element

maxWidth.description: The maximum width of the element

animateEasing.description: The Easing to apply to the animation.

yTicks.description: The number of y ticks to span the resize to.

animate.description: Should be use animation to resize the element (can only be used if we use proxy).

knobHandles.description: Use the smaller handles, instead if the full size handles.

minWidth.description: The minimum width of the element

ratio.description: Maintain the element's ratio when resizing.

minX.description: The minimum x coord of the element

minY.description: The minimum y coord of the element

handles.description:
The handles to use (any combination of): 't', 'b', 'r', 'l', 'bl', 'br', 'tl', 'tr'. Defaults to: ['r', 'b', 'br'].
Can use a shortcut of All. Note: 8 way resizing should be done on an element that is absolutely positioned.

status.description: Show the status (new size) of the resize.

hover.description: Only show the handles when they are being moused over.

minHeight.description: The minimum height of the element

xTicks.description: The number of x ticks to span the resize to.

proxy.description: Resize a proxy element instead of the real element.

hiddenHandles.description: Don't show the handles, just use the cursor to the user.

animateDuration.description: The Duration to apply to the animation.

ghost.description: Apply an opacity filter to the element being resized (only works with proxy).

useShim.description:
This setting will be passed to the DragDrop instances on the resize handles and for the draggable property.
This property should be used if you want the resize handles to work over iframe and other elements.

maxHeight.description: The maximum height of the element

autoRatio.description: Using the shift key during a resize will toggle the ratio config.

draggable.description: A convienence method to make the element draggable

setSize.description:
Set the size of the resized element, if set to false the element will not be auto resized,
the resize event will contain the dimensions so the end user can resize it on their own.
This setting will only work with proxy set to true and animate set to false.

YAHOO.util.Config.name: YAHOO.util.Config

params.name: owner
params.description: The owner Object to which this Config Object belongs

constructors.description:
Config is a utility used within an Object to allow the implementer to
maintain a list of local configuration properties and listen for changes 
to those properties dynamically using CustomEvent. The initial values are 
also maintained so that the configuration can be reset at any given point 
to its initial state.

configChangedEvent.description:
Custom Event, notifying subscribers when Config properties are set 
(setProperty is called without the silent flag

fireQueue.description: Fires the normalized list of queued property change events

return.description:
true, if the function/Object pair is already subscribed 
to the CustomEvent passed in

YAHOO.util.Config.alreadySubscribed.description:
Checks to determine if a particular function/Object pair are already 
subscribed to the specified CustomEvent

params.name: evt
params.description:
The CustomEvent for which to check 
the subscriptions

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to look for in the subscribers list

params.name: obj
params.description: The execution scope Object for the subscription

return.description: The value of the specified property

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

getProperty.description: Returns the value of specified property.

params.name: key
params.description: The configuration property's name

params.name: propertyObject
params.description:
The Object containing all of this 
property's arguments

addProperty.description: Adds a property to the Config Object's private config hash.

return.description:
true, if the set was successful, false if 
it failed.

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

params.name: value
params.description: The value to set the property to

queueProperty.description:
Sets the value of a property and queues its event to execute. If the 
event is already scheduled to execute, it is
moved from its current position to the end of the queue.

return.description: true, if the value is valid

params.name: val
params.description: The value to validate

checkNumber.description: Validates that the value passed in is a number.

return.description:
The string list of CustomEvents currently queued 
for execution

outputEventQueue.description:
Returns a string representation of the Config object's current 
CustomEvent queue

return.description: True is the property was reset, false if not

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

resetProperty.description: Resets the specified property's value to its initial value.

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration Object literal

params.name: init
params.description:
When set to true, the initialConfig will 
be set to the userConfig passed in, so that calling a reset will 
reset the properties to the passed values.

applyConfig.description:
Applies a key-value Object literal to the configuration, replacing  
any existing values, and queueing the property events.
Although the values will be set, fireQueue() must be called for their 
associated events to execute.

refresh.description:
Refires the events for all configuration properties using their 
current values.

return.description:
True, if the subscription was successful, 
otherwise false.

params.name: key
params.description: The property name

params.name: handler
params.description:
The handler function to use subscribe to 
the property's event

params.name: obj
params.description:
The Object to use for scoping the event handler 
(see CustomEvent documentation)

params.name: overrideContext
params.description:
Optional. If true, will override
"this" within the handler to map to the scope Object passed into the
method.

subscribeToConfigEvent.description:
Subscribes an external handler to the change event for any 
given property.

return.description: true, if the value is valid

params.name: val
params.description: The value to validate

checkBoolean.description: Validates that the value passed in is a Boolean.

params.name: owner
params.description:
The owner Object to which this Config 
Object belongs

init.description: Initializes the configuration Object and all of its local members.

return.description: The Config object in string format.

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the Config object

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

refireEvent.description: Fires the event for a property using the property's current value.

return.description: The current config, represented in a key-value map

getConfig.description:
Returns a key-value configuration map of the values currently set in  
the Config Object.

return.description: True, if the set was successful, false if it failed.

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

params.name: value
params.description: The value to set the property to

params.name: silent
params.description:
Whether the value should be set silently, 
without firing the property event.

setProperty.description:
Sets the value of a property. If the silent property is passed as 
true, the property's event will not be fired.

destroy.description:
Sets all properties to null, unsubscribes all listeners from each 
property's change event and all listeners from the configChangedEvent.

params.name: key
params.description: The configuration property's name

params.name: Object
params.description: The value of the correct type for the property

fireEvent.description: Fires a configuration property event using the specified value.

return.description:
True, if the unsubscription was successful, 
otherwise false.

params.name: key
params.description: The property name

params.name: handler
params.description:
The handler function to use subscribe to 
the property's event

params.name: obj
params.description:
The Object to use for scoping the event 
handler (see CustomEvent documentation)

unsubscribeFromConfigEvent.description:
Unsubscribes an external handler from the change event for any 
given property.

YAHOO.util.Config.CONFIG_CHANGED_EVENT.description: Constant representing the CustomEvent type for the config changed event.

eventQueue.description: Maintains the local, normalized CustomEvent queue

owner.description: Object reference to the owner of this Config Object

queueInProgress.description:
Boolean flag that specifies whether a queue is currently 
being executed

initialConfig.description:
Maintains the local collection of configuration property objects as 
they were initially applied.
This object is used when resetting a property.

config.description:
Maintains the local collection of configuration property objects and 
their specified values

YAHOO.util.Config.BOOLEAN_TYPE.description: Constant representing the boolean type string

YAHOO.util.Config.description:
Config is a utility used within an Object to allow the implementer to
maintain a list of local configuration properties and listen for changes 
to those properties dynamically using CustomEvent. The initial values are 
also maintained so that the configuration can be reset at any given point 
to its initial state.

YAHOO.widget.Node.name: YAHOO.widget.Node

params.name: oData
params.description:
a string or object containing the data that will
be used to render this node, and any custom attributes that should be
stored with the node (which is available in noderef.data).
All values in oData will be used to set equally named properties in the node
as long as the node does have such properties, they are not undefined, private or functions,
the rest of the values will be stored in noderef.data

params.name: oParent
params.description: this node's parent node

params.name: expanded
params.description: the initial expanded/collapsed state (deprecated, use oData.expanded)

constructors.description:
The base class for all tree nodes.  The node's presentation and behavior in
response to mouse events is handled in Node subclasses.

parentChange.description:
The parentChange event is fired when a parent element is applied
to the node.  This is useful if you need to apply tree-level
properties to a tree that need to happen if a node is moved from
one tree to another.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the property to be set

params.name: value
params.description: value to be set

params.name: refresh
params.description: if present and true, it does a refresh

setNodesProperty.description:
Sets the value of property for this node and all loaded descendants.  
Only public and defined properties can be set, not methods.  
Values for unknown properties will be assigned to the refNode.data object

return.description: the child node

appendChild.description: Appends a node to the child collection.

params.name: childNode
params.description: the new node

params.name: fmDataLoader
params.description: the function that will be used to get the data.

params.name: iconMode
params.description:
configures the icon that is displayed when a dynamic
load node is expanded the first time without children.  By default, the 
"collapse" icon will be used.  If set to 1, the leaf node icon will be
displayed.

setDynamicLoad.description:
Configures this node for dynamically obtaining the child data
when the node is first expanded.  Calling it without the callback
will turn off dynamic load for the node.

params.name: _silent
params.description: optional, don't fire the highlightEvent

_childrenHighlighted.description:
Checks whether all or part of the children of a node are highlighted and
sets the node highlight to full, none or partial highlight.
If set to propagate it will further call the parent

return.description: this node's children div

getChildrenEl.description: Returns the div that was generated for this node's children

_removeFocus.description: Removes the focus of previously selected Node

toggle.description: Expands if node is collapsed, collapses otherwise.

return.description: value entered

params.name: editorData
params.description: a shortcut to the static object holding editing information

getEditorValue.description:
Returns the value(s) from the input element(s) .
Should be overridden by each node type.

return.description: a return of exactly false will prevent the editor from closing

params.name: editorData
params.description: a shortcut to the static object holding editing information

saveEditorValue.description: Saves the value entered into the editor.

return.description: the javascript url for toggling this node

getToggleLink.description: Generates the link that will invoke this node's toggle method

return.description: this node's toggle html element

getToggleEl.description: Returns the element that is being used for this node's toggle.

toggleHighlight.description: Toggles the highlighted state of a Node

return.description: the markup for this node and its expanded children.

getHtml.description: Returns the markup for this node and its children.

return.description: the inserted node

params.name: node
params.description: the node to insert this node before

insertBefore.description: Inserts this node before this supplied node

return.description:
true if this has children or if it might and we are
checking for this condition.

params.name: checkForLazyLoad
params.description: should we check for unloaded children?

hasChildren.description:
Checks if this node has children.  If this node is lazy-loading and the
children have not been rendered, we do not know whether or not there
are actual children.  In most cases, we need to assume that there are
children (for instance, the toggle needs to show the expandable 
presentation state).  In other times we want to know if there are rendered
children.  For the latter, "checkForLazyLoad" should be false.

return.description: true if this node's children are to be loaded dynamically

isDynamic.description:
Evaluates if this node's children should be loaded dynamically.  Looks for
the property both in this instance and the root node.  If the tree is
defined to load all children dynamically, the data callback function is
defined in the root node

params.name: oData
params.description:
a string or object containing the data that will
be used to render this node

params.name: oParent
params.description: this node's parent node

params.name: expanded
params.description: the initial expanded/collapsed state

init.description: Initializes this node, gets some of the properties from the parent

return.description: the container html element

getEl.description: Returns this node's container html element

return.description: The appended node

params.name: parentNode
params.description: the node to append to.

appendTo.description: Appends this node to the supplied node's child collection

return.description: the element

getContentEl.description: Returns the outer html element for this node's content

return.description: the inserted node

params.name: node
params.description: the node to insert after

insertAfter.description: Inserts this node after the supplied node

return.description: string representation of the node

toString.description: Node toString

return.description: the element id for this node's children div

getChildrenElId.description: Returns the id for this node's children div

return.description: the css class for the spacer

params.name: depth
params.description: the depth of the ancestor.

getDepthStyle.description:
Returns the css class for the spacer at the specified depth for
this node.  If this node's ancestor at the specified depth
has a next sibling the presentation is different than if it
does not have a next sibling

return.description: success

_canHaveFocus.description:
Returns true if there are any elements in the node that can 
accept the real actual browser focus

expandAll.description: Recursively expands all of this node's children.

return.description: number of nodes in the branch

getNodeCount.description: Count of nodes in a branch

collapse.description: Hides this nodes children (creating them if necessary), changes the toggle style.

return.description: Node[]

getSiblings.description: Returns a node array of this node's siblings, null if none.

editNode.description: pops up the contents editor, if there is one and the node is declared editable

return.description: The HTML that will render the content of this node.

getContentHtml.description:
Get the markup for the contents of the node.  This is designed to be overrided so that we can
support different types of nodes.

return.description: success

focus.description:
Sets the focus on the node element.
It will only be able to set the focus on nodes that have anchor elements in it.  
Toggle or branch icons have anchors and can be focused on.  
If will fail in nodes that have no anchor

params.name: value
params.description: value to be displayed and stored in the node

params.name: editorData
params.description: a shortcut to the static object holding editing information

displayEditedValue.description:
Finally displays the newly edited value(s) in the tree.
Should be overridden by each node type.

return.description: the css class for this node's toggle

getStyle.description: Returns the css style name for the toggle

return.description: The HTML that will render this node.

getNodeHtml.description:
Get the markup for the node.  This may be overrided so that we can
support different types of nodes.

return.description: 0 for collapse style, 1 for leaf node style

getIconMode.description:
Returns the current icon mode.  This refers to the way childless dynamic
load nodes appear (this comes into play only after the initial dynamic
load request produced no children).

_setHighlightClassName.description: Changes the classNames on the toggle and content containers to reflect the current highlighting

params.name: editorData
params.description: a shortcut to the static object holding editing information

destroyEditorContents.description:
Node-specific destroy function to empty the contents of the inline editor panel.
This function is the worst case alternative that will purge all possible events and remove the editor contents.
Method Event.purgeElement is somewhat costly so if it can be replaced by specifc Event.removeListeners, it is better to do so.

return.description: the ancestor

params.name: depth
params.description: the depth of the ancestor.

getAncestor.description: Returns this node's ancestor at the specified depth.

loadComplete.description:
Load complete is the callback function we pass to the data provider
in dynamic load situations.

expand.description:
Shows this nodes children (creating them if necessary), changes the
toggle style, and collapses its siblings if multiExpand is not set.

return.description: the element id

getElId.description: Returns the id for this node's container div

return.description: true if this is the root node

isRoot.description: Evaluates if this node is the root node of the tree

return.description: void

params.name: editorData
params.description: a shortcut to the static object holding editing information

fillEditorContainer.description:
Placeholder for a function that should provide the inline node label editor.
Leaving it set to null will indicate that this node type is not editable.
It should be overridden by nodes that provide inline editing.
The Node-specific editing element (input box, textarea or whatever) should be inserted into editorData.inputContainer.

return.description: children html

completeRender.description: Called when we know we have all the child data.

return.description:
The node index if this Node is a child of 
supplied Node, else -1.

isChildOf.description: Returns true if the Node is a child of supplied Node

params.name: parentNode
params.description: the Node to check

return.description: the children container div html and any expanded children

getChildrenHtml.description:
Called when first rendering the tree.  We always build the div that will
contain this nodes children, but we don't render the children themselves
unless this node is expanded.

refresh.description:
Regenerates the html for this node and its children.  To be used when the
node is expanded and new children have been added.

return.description: the toggel element id

getToggleElId.description: Returns the id for this node's toggle element

return.description: definition of the tree or false if the node or any children is defined as dynamic

getNodeDefinition.description:
Returns an object which could be used to build a tree out of this node and its children.
It can be passed to the tree constructor to reproduce this node as a tree.
It will return false if the node or any children loads dynamically, regardless of whether it is loaded or not.

params.name: _silent
params.description: optional, don't fire the highlightEvent

return.description: the html for this node's children

renderChildren.description:
Generates the markup for the child nodes.  This is not done until the node
is expanded.

return.description: the css class hover state

getHoverStyle.description: Returns the hover style for the icon

collapseAll.description: Recursively collapses all of this node's children.

return.description: true if the application was successful

params.name: parentNode
params.description: this node's parent node

applyParent.description:
Certain properties for the node cannot be set until the parent
is known. This is called after the node is inserted into a tree.
the parent is also applied to this node's children in order to
make it possible to move a branch from one tree to another.

childrenRendered.description:
This flag is set to true when the html is generated for this node's
children, and set to false when new children are added.

_focusedItem.description: DOM element that actually got the browser focus

renderHidden.description:
Should we render children for a collapsed node?  It is possible that the
implementer will want to render the hidden data...  @todo verify that we 
need this, and implement it if we do.

className.description: User-defined className to be added to the Node

iconMode.description:
Used to configure what happens when a dynamic load node is expanded
and we discover that it does not have children.  By default, it is
treated as if it still could have children (plus/minus icon).  Set
iconMode to have it display like a leaf node instead.

isLoading.description:
This is true for dynamically loading nodes while waiting for the
callback to return.

nowrap.description:
Specifies whether or not the content area of the node should be allowed
to wrap.

multiExpand.description: Can multiple children be expanded at once?

index.description: The index for this instance obtained from global counter in YAHOO.widget.TreeView.

_focusHighlightedItems.description:
array of items that had the focus set on them
so that they can be cleaned when focus is lost

propagateHighlightDown.description: Tells whether highlighting will be propagated down to the children of the clicked node

_dynLoad.description:
We can set the node up to call an external method to get the child
data dynamically.

contentStyle.description:
The CSS class for the html content container.  Defaults to ygtvhtml, but 
can be overridden to provide a custom presentation for a specific node.

propagateHighlightUp.description: Tells whether highlighting will be propagated up to the parents of the clicked node

highlightState.description:
Stores the highlight state. Can be any of:
  • 0 - not highlighted
  • 1 - highlighted
  • 2 - some children highlighted

dataLoader.description: Function to execute when we need to get this node's child data.

editable.description: Signals if the label is editable.  (Ignored on TextNodes with href set.)

data.description:
The data linked to this node.  This can be any object or primitive
value, and the data can be used in getNodeHtml().

dynamicLoadComplete.description:
Dynamically loaded nodes only fetch the data the first time they are
expanded.  This flag is set to true once the data has been fetched.

isLeaf.description:
If true, the node will alway be rendered as a leaf node.  This can be
used to override the presentation when dynamically loading the entire
tree.  Setting this to true also disables the dynamic load call for the
node.

hasIcon.description:
The toggle/branch icon will not show if this is set to false.  This
could be useful if the implementer wants to have the child contain
extra info about the parent, rather than an actual node.

contentElId.description: The generated id that will contain the data passed in by the implementer.

tree.description: Tree instance this node is part of

enableHighlight.description: Enables node highlighting.  If true, the node can be highlighted and/or propagate highlighting

depth.description: The depth of this node.  We start at -1 for the root node.

YAHOO.widget.Node.description:
The base class for all tree nodes.  The node's presentation and behavior in
response to mouse events is handled in Node subclasses.

params.name: optional
params.description: function reference

In IE, the onAvailable/onDOMReady events need help when Event is
loaded dynamically

params.name: mod
params.description: The module definition from moduleInfo

getRequires.description:
Returns an object containing properties for all modules required
in order to load the requested module

onProgress.description: Callback that will be executed each time a new module is loaded

onTimeout.description: Callback that will be executed if a timeout occurs

return.description: what this module provides

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the module

params.name: notMe
params.description: don't add this module name, only include superseded modules

getProvides.description: Returns an object literal of the modules the supplied module satisfies

_reduce.description:
Remove superceded modules and loaded modules.  Called by
calculate() after we have the mega list of all dependencies

params.name: o
params.description: optional options object

calculate.description:
Calculates the dependency tree, the result is stored in the sorted 
property

return.description: the filtered string
the module name for the skin

_addSkin.description: Adds the skin def to the module info

params.name: skin
params.description: the name of the skin

params.name: mod
params.description: the name of the module

_explode.description:
Inspects the required modules list looking for additional 
dependencies.  Expands the required list to include all 
required modules.  Called by calculate()

return.description: the full skin module name

params.name: skin
params.description: the name of the skin

params.name: mod
params.description: optional: the name of a module to skin

formatSkin.description:
Returns the skin module name for the specified skin name.  If a
module name is supplied, the returned skin module name is 
specific to the module passed in.

return.description:
the parsed skin name 
and module name, or null if the supplied string does not match
the skin pattern

params.name: mod
params.description: the module name to parse

parseSkin.description: Reverses formatSkin, providing the skin name and module name if the string matches the pattern for skins.

return.description:
true if the module was added, false if 
the object passed in did not provide all required attributes

params.name: o
params.description: An object containing the module data

addModule.description:
Add a new module to the component metadata.         
<dl>
<dt>name:</dt>       <dd>required, the component name</dd>
<dt>type:</dt>       <dd>required, the component type (js or css)</dd>
<dt>path:</dt>       <dd>required, the path to the script from "base"</dd>
<dt>requires:</dt>   <dd>array of modules required by this component</dd>
<dt>optional:</dt>   <dd>array of optional modules for this component</dd>
<dt>supersedes:</dt> <dd>array of the modules this component replaces</dd>
<dt>after:</dt>      <dd>array of modules the components which, if present, should be sorted above this one</dd>
<dt>rollup:</dt>     <dd>the number of superseded modules required for automatic rollup</dd>
<dt>fullpath:</dt>   <dd>If fullpath is specified, this is used instead of the configured base + path</dd>
<dt>skinnable:</dt>  <dd>flag to determine if skin assets should automatically be pulled in</dd>
</dl>

params.name: mname
params.description:
optional the name of the module that has
been loaded (which is usually why it is time to load the next
one)

loadNext.description:
Executed every time a module is loaded, and if we are in a load
cycle, we attempt to load the next script.  Public so that it
is possible to call this if using a method other than
YAHOO.register to determine when scripts are fully loaded

_rollup.description:
Look for rollup packages to determine if all of the modules a
rollup supersedes are required.  If so, include the rollup to
help reduce the total number of connections required.  Called
by calculate()

params.name: o
params.description: optional options object

params.name: type
params.description: the type of dependency to insert

insert.description: inserts the requested modules and their dependencies. type can be "js" or "css". Both script and css are inserted if type is not provided.

_sort.description: Sorts the dependency tree.  The last step of calculate()

onFailure.description: Callback that will be executed if there is a failure

params.name: what
params.description: the modules to load

require.description: Add a requirement for one or more module

_setup.description:
Investigates the current YUI configuration on the page.  By default,
modules already detected will not be loaded again unless a force
option is encountered.  Called by calculate()

onSuccess.description:
Callback that will be executed when the loader is finished
with an insert

params.name: callback
params.description:
the callback to exectued when the load is
complete.

sandbox.description:
Interns the script for the requested modules.  The callback is
provided a reference to the sandboxed YAHOO object.  This only
applies to the script: css can not be sandboxed; css will be
loaded into the page normally if specified.

return.description: the full url

_url.description:
Generates the full url for a module
method _url

params.name: path
params.description: the path fragment

force.description:
A list of modules that should always be loaded, even
if they have already been inserted into the page.

varName.description:
The name of the variable in a sandbox or script node 
(for external script support in Safari 2.x and earlier)
to reference when the load is complete.  If this variable 
is not available in the specified scripts, the operation will 
fail.

rollups.description: List of rollup files found in the library metadata

loaded.description:
Set when beginning to compute the dependency tree. 
Composed of what YAHOO reports to be loaded combined
with what has been loaded by the tool

_internalCallback.description:
Internal callback to handle multiple internal insert() calls
so that css is inserted prior to js

inserted.description: List of modules inserted by the utility

charset.description: The charset attribute for inserted nodes

loadOptional.description:
Whether or not to load optional dependencies for 
the requested modules

combine.description:
If configured, YUI will use the the combo handler on the
Yahoo! CDN to pontentially reduce the number of http requests
required.

scope.description: The execution scope for all callbacks

filter.description:
A filter to apply to result urls. This filter will modify the default path for all modules. The default path for the YUI library is the minified version of the files (e.g., event-min.js). The filter property can be a predefined filter or a custom filter. The valid predefined filters are:
DEBUG
Selects the debug versions of the library (e.g., event-debug.js). This option will automatically include the logger widget
RAW
Selects the non-minified version of the library (e.g., event.js).
You can also define a custom filter, which must be an object literal containing a search expression and a replace string: 
myFilter: { 
'searchExp': "-min\\.js", 
'replaceStr': "-debug.js"
}

comboBase.description: Base path for the combo service

insertBefore.description: Node reference or id where new nodes should be inserted before

sorted.description:
All of the derived dependencies in sorted order, which
will be populated when either calculate() or insert()
is called

data.description: Data that is passed to all callbacks

_useYahooListener.description:
Use the YAHOO environment listener to detect script load.  This
is only switched on for Safari 2.x and below.

ignore.description:
A list of modules that should not be loaded, even if
they turn up in the dependency tree

dirty.description:
Flag to indicate the dependency tree needs to be recomputed
if insert is called again.

timeout.description:
Timeout value in milliseconds.  If set, this value will be used by
the get utility.  the timeout event will fire if
a timeout occurs.

root.description:
Root path to prepend to module path for the combo
service

YAHOO.util.Motion.name: YAHOO.util.Motion

params.name: el
params.description: Reference to the element that will be animated

params.name: attributes
params.description:
The attribute(s) to be animated.  
Each attribute is an object with at minimum a "to" or "by" member defined.  
Additional optional members are "from" (defaults to current value), "units" (defaults to "px").  
All attribute names use camelCase.

params.name: duration
params.description: (optional, defaults to 1 second) Length of animation (frames or seconds), defaults to time-based

params.name: method
params.description: (optional, defaults to YAHOO.util.Easing.easeNone) Computes the values that are applied to the attributes per frame (generally a YAHOO.util.Easing method)

constructors.description:
Anim subclass for moving elements along a path defined by the "points" member of "attributes". All "points" are arrays with x, y coordinates.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Motion(el, { points: { to: [800, 800] } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

YAHOO.util.Motion.description:
Anim subclass for moving elements along a path defined by the "points" member of "attributes". All "points" are arrays with x, y coordinates.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Motion(el, { points: { to: [800, 800] } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

constructors.description: A type of axis whose units are measured in time-based values.

stackingEnabled.description: Series that are stackable will only stack when this value is set to true.

calculateByLabelSize.description: Indicates whether to factor in the size of the labels when calculating a major unit.

minimum.description:
The minimum value drawn by the axis. If not set explicitly, the axis minimum
will be calculated automatically.

maximum.description:
The maximum value drawn by the axis. If not set explicitly, the axis maximum
will be calculated automatically.

majorTimeUnit.description: The time unit used by the majorUnit.

majorUnit.description: The spacing between major intervals on this axis.

snapToUnits.description:
If true, the labels, ticks, gridlines, and other objects will snap to
the nearest major or minor unit. If false, their position will be based
on the minimum value.

YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.name: YAHOO.util.CustomEvent

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of event, which is passed to the callback
when the event fires

params.name: context
params.description:
The context the event will fire from.  "this" will
refer to this object in the callback.  Default value: 
the window object.  The listener can override this.

params.name: silent
params.description:
pass true to prevent the event from writing to
the debugsystem

params.name: signature
params.description:
the signature that the custom event subscriber
will receive. YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.LIST or 
YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.FLAT.  The default is
YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.LIST.

params.name: fireOnce
params.description:
If configured to fire once, the custom event 
will only notify subscribers a single time regardless of how many times 
the event is fired.  In addition, new subscribers will be notified 
immediately if the event has already been fired.

constructors.description:
The CustomEvent class lets you define events for your application
that can be subscribed to by one or more independent component.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to execute

params.name: obj
params.description:
<Object> An object to be passed along when the event fires. 
Defaults to the custom event.

params.name: override
params.description:
<boolean|Object> If true, the obj passed in becomes the 
execution context of the listener. If an object, that object becomes 
the execution context. Defaults to the custom event.

subscribeEvent.description:
Custom events provide a custom event that fires whenever there is
a new subscriber to the event.  This provides an opportunity to
handle the case where there is a non-repeating event that has
already fired has a new subscriber.

return.description:
false if one of the subscribers returned false, 
true otherwise

params.name: arguments
params.description:
an arbitrary set of parameters to pass to 
the handler.

fire.description:
Notifies the subscribers. The callback functions will be executed from the context specified when the event was created, and with the following parameters:
  • The type of event
  • All of the arguments fire() was executed with as an array
  • The custom object (if any) that was passed into the subscribe() method

return.description: The number of listeners unsubscribed

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to execute

params.name: obj
params.description:
An object to be passed along when the event fires.
overrideContext <boolean|Object> If true, the obj passed in becomes the execution 
context of the listener. If an object, that object becomes the execution context.

subscribe.description: Subscribes the caller to this event

return.description: True if the subscriber was found and detached.

params.name: fn
params.description:
The subscribed function to remove, if not supplied
all will be removed

params.name: obj
params.description:
The custom object passed to subscribe.  This is
optional, but if supplied will be used to
disambiguate multiple listeners that are the same
(e.g., you subscribe many object using a function
that lives on the prototype)

fired.description: Indicates whether or not this event has ever been fired.

fireOnce.description:
If configured to fire once, the custom event will only notify subscribers
a single time regardless of how many times the event is fired.  In addition,
new subscribers will be notified immediately if the event has already been
fired.

YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.FLAT.description:
Subscriber listener sigature constant.  The FLAT type returns two
parameters: the first argument passed to fire and the optional 
custom object

firedWith.description:
For fireOnce events the arguments the event was fired with are stored
so that new subscribers get the proper payload.

signature.description:
Custom events support two styles of arguments provided to the event subscribers.
  • YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.LIST:
    • param1: event name
    • param2: array of arguments sent to fire
    • param3: a custom object supplied by the subscriber
  • YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.FLAT
    • param1: the first argument passed to fire. If you need to pass multiple parameters, use and array or object literal
    • param2: a custom object supplied by the subscriber

YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.LIST.description:
Subscriber listener sigature constant.  The LIST type returns three
parameters: the event type, the array of args passed to fire, and
the optional custom object

scope.description: The context the event will fire from by default. Defaults to the window obj.

lastError.description:
In order to make it possible to execute the rest of the subscriber
stack when one thows an exception, the subscribers exceptions are
caught.  The most recent exception is stored in this property

type.description: The type of event, returned to subscribers when the event fires

silent.description:
By default all custom events are logged in the debug build. Set silent to true 
to disable debug output for this event.

YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.description:
The CustomEvent class lets you define events for your application
that can be subscribed to by one or more independent component.

YAHOO.widget.Module.name: YAHOO.widget.Module

appendtodocumentbody.description:
Specifies if the module should be rendered as the first child of document.body or appended as the last child when render is called with document.body as the "appendToNode".

Appending to the body while the DOM is still being constructed can lead to Operation Aborted errors in IE hence this flag is set to false by default.

visible.description: Specifies whether the Module is visible on the page.

monitorresize.description:
Specifies whether to create a special proxy iframe to monitor 
for user font resizing in the document

effect.description:
Object or array of objects representing the ContainerEffect classes that are active for animating the container.

NOTE: Although this configuration property is introduced at the Module level, an out of the box implementation is not shipped for the Module class so setting the proroperty on the Module class has no effect. The Overlay class is the first class to provide out of the box ContainerEffect support.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Module OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Module

params.name: userConfig
params.description:
The configuration Object literal containing 
the configuration that should be set for this module. See configuration 
documentation for more details.

constructors.description:
Module is a JavaScript representation of the Standard Module Format. 
Standard Module Format is a simple standard for markup containers where 
child nodes representing the header, body, and footer of the content are 
denoted using the CSS classes "hd", "bd", and "ft" respectively. 
Module is the base class for all other classes in the YUI 
Container package.

params.name: classRef
params.description:
class reference of the initializing 
class, such as this.beforeInitEvent.fire(Module)

YAHOO.widget.Module.textResizeEvent.description:
Singleton CustomEvent fired when the font size is changed in the browser.
Opera's "zoom" functionality currently does not support text 
size detection.

hideEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after the Module is hidden

beforeHideEvent.description: CustomEvent fired before the Module is hidden

params.name: content
params.description:
String/element representing 
the new body content

changeBodyEvent.description: CustomEvent fired when the body content of the Module is modified

beforeRenderEvent.description: CustomEvent fired before the Module is rendered

changeContentEvent.description: CustomEvent fired when the content of the Module is modified

beforeShowEvent.description: CustomEvent fired before the Module is shown

params.name: content
params.description:
String/element representing 
the new footer content

changeFooterEvent.description:
CustomEvent fired when the footer content of the Module 
is modified

renderEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after the Module is rendered

showEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after the Module is shown

params.name: classRef
params.description:
class reference of the initializing 
class, such as this.beforeInitEvent.fire(Module)

beforeInitEvent.description: CustomEvent fired prior to class initalization.

appendEvent.description: CustomEvent fired when the Module is appended to the DOM

params.name: content
params.description:
String/element representing 
the new header content

changeHeaderEvent.description:
CustomEvent fired when the header content of the Module 
is modified

destroyEvent.description: CustomEvent fired when the Module is destroyed

return.description: Success or failure of the render

params.name: appendToNode
params.description: The element id to which the Module should be appended to prior to rendering OR

params.name: appendToNode
params.description:
The element to which the Module 
should be appended to prior to rendering

params.name: moduleElement
params.description:
OPTIONAL. The element that 
represents the actual Standard Module container.

render.description:
Renders the Module by inserting the elements that are not already in the main Module into their correct places. Optionally appends the Module to the specified node prior to the render's execution.

For Modules without existing markup, the appendToNode argument is REQUIRED. If this argument is ommitted and the current element is not present in the document, the function will return false, indicating that the render was a failure.

NOTE: As of 2.3.1, if the appendToNode is the document's body element then the module is rendered as the first child of the body element, and not appended to it, to avoid Operation Aborted errors in IE when rendering the module before window's load event is fired. You can use the appendtodocumentbody configuration property to change this to append to document.body if required.

show.description:
Shows the Module element by setting the visible configuration 
property to true. Also fires two events: beforeShowEvent prior to 
the visibility change, and showEvent after.

params.name: moduleElement
params.description: Optional. A reference to the module element.

_renderBody.description:
Renders the currently set body into it's proper position under the 
module element. If the module element is not provided, "this.element" 
is used.

params.name: moduleElement
params.description: Optional. A reference to the module element

_renderHeader.description:
Renders the currently set header into it's proper position under the 
module element. If the module element is not provided, "this.element" 
is used.

params.name: bodyContent
params.description: The HTML used to set the body. As a convenience, non HTMLElement objects can also be passed into the method, and will be treated as strings, with the body innerHTML set to their default toString implementations. OR

params.name: bodyContent
params.description: The HTMLElement to add as the first and only child of the body element. OR

params.name: bodyContent
params.description:
The document fragment

If no body is present, one will be automatically created. 
An empty string can be passed to the method to clear the contents of the body.

hide.description:
Hides the Module element by setting the visible configuration 
property to false. Also fires two events: beforeHideEvent prior to 
the visibility change, and hideEvent after.

automatically at appropriate times by the Module class.

that can be used to detect text resize.

The Module class's initialization method, which is executed for Module and all of its subclasses. This method is automatically called by the constructor, and sets up all DOM references for pre-existing markup, and creates required markup if it is not already present.

If the element passed in does not have an id, one will be generated for it.

_addToParent.description:
This method is a protected helper, used when constructing the DOM structure for the module to account for situations which may cause Operation Aborted errors in IE. It should not be used for general DOM construction.

If the parentNode is not document.body, the element is appended as the last element.

If the parentNode is document.body the element is added as the first child to help prevent Operation Aborted errors in IE.

Constant representing the buffer amount (in pixels) to use when positioning

DEFAULT_CONFIG.description: Constant representing the Module's configuration properties

browser.description: String representing the user-agent of the browser

YAHOO.widget.Module.description:
Module is a JavaScript representation of the Standard Module Format. 
Standard Module Format is a simple standard for markup containers where 
child nodes representing the header, body, and footer of the content are 
denoted using the CSS classes "hd", "bd", and "ft" respectively. 
Module is the base class for all other classes in the YUI 
Container package.

hasOwnProperty.description:
Determines whether or not the property was added to the object instance. Returns false if the property is not present in the object, or was inherited from the prototype. This abstraction is provided to enable hasOwnProperty for Safari 1.3.x. There is a discrepancy between YAHOO.lang.hasOwnProperty and Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty when the property is a primitive added to both the instance AND prototype with the same value: 
var A = function() {};
A.prototype.foo = 'foo';
var a = new A();
a.foo = 'foo';
alert(a.hasOwnProperty('foo')); // true
alert(YAHOO.lang.hasOwnProperty(a, 'foo')); // false when using fallback

params.description: The object being testing

matching items obtained from the superclass

Utility to set up the prototype, constructor and superclass properties to
support an inheritance strategy that can chain constructors and methods.
Static members will not be inherited.

will overwrite those in earlier objects.

a timer object. Call the cancel() method on this object to

the function to execute or the name of

params.description:
[Array] data that is provided to the function.  This accepts
either a single item or an array.  If an array is provided, the
function is executed with one parameter for each array item.  If
you need to pass a single array parameter, it needs to be wrapped in
an array [myarray]

params.name: periodic
params.description:
if true, executes continuously at supplied 
interval until canceled

return.description: the substituted string

substitute.description:
Does variable substitution on a string. It scans through the string 
looking for expressions enclosed in { } braces. If an expression 
is found, it is used a key on the object.  If there is a space in
the key, the first word is used for the key and the rest is provided
to an optional function to be used to programatically determine the
value (the extra information might be used for this decision). If 
the value for the key in the object, or what is returned from the
function has a string value, number value, or object value, it is 
substituted for the bracket expression and it repeats.  If this
value is an object, it uses the Object's toString() if this has
been overridden, otherwise it does a shallow dump of the key/value
pairs.

params.name: s
params.description: The string that will be modified.

params.name: o
params.description: An object containing the replacement values

params.name: f
params.description:
An optional function that can be used to
process each match.  It receives the key,
value, and any extra metadata included with
the key inside of the braces.

augmentObject.description:
Applies all properties in the supplier to the receiver if the
receiver does not have these properties yet.  Optionally, one or 
more methods/properties can be specified (as additional 
parameters).  This option will overwrite the property if receiver 
has it already.  If true is passed as the third parameter, all 
properties will be applied and _will_ overwrite properties in 
the receiver.

params.name: r
params.description: the object to receive the augmentation

params.name: s
params.description: the object that supplies the properties to augment

params.name: arguments
params.description:
zero or more properties methods 
to augment the receiver with.  If none specified, everything
in the supplier will be used unless it would
overwrite an existing property in the receiver. If true
is specified as the third parameter, all properties will
be applied and will overwrite an existing property in
the receiver

augment.description:
Same as YAHOO.lang.augmentObject, except it only applies prototype

Determines whether or not the provided object is a function.
Note: Internet Explorer thinks certain functions are objects:

YAHOO.lang.isFunction(obj.getAttribute) // reports false in IE
var input = document.createElement("input"); // append to body
YAHOO.lang.isFunction(input.focus) // reports false in IE
You will have to implement additional tests if these functions
matter to you.

YAHOO.widget.DataTable.name: YAHOO.widget.DataTable

numberOptions.description: Default config passed to YAHOO.util.Number.format() by the 'number' Column formatter.

initialLoad.description:
Determines whether or not to load data at instantiation. By
default, will trigger a sendRequest() to the DataSource and pass in the
request defined by initialRequest. If set to false, data will not load
at instantiation. Alternatively, implementers who wish to work with a 
custom payload may pass in an object literal with the following values:
<dl>
<dt>request (MIXED)</dt>
<dd>Request value.</dd>
<dt>argument (MIXED)</dt>
<dd>Custom data that will be passed through to the callback function.</dd>
</dl>

initialRequest.description:
Defines the initial request that gets sent to the DataSource
during initialization. Value is ignored if initialLoad is set to any value
other than true.

formatRow.description:
A function that accepts a TR element and its associated Record
for custom formatting. The function must return TRUE in order to automatically
continue formatting of child TD elements, else TD elements will not be
automatically formatted.

renderLoopSize.description:
A value greater than 0 enables DOM rendering of rows to be
executed from a non-blocking timeout queue and sets how many rows to be
rendered per timeout. Recommended for very large data sets.

sortedBy.description:
Object literal provides metadata for initial sort values if
data will arrive pre-sorted:
<dl>
<dt>sortedBy.key</dt>
<dd>{String} Key of sorted Column</dd>
<dt>sortedBy.dir</dt>
<dd>{String} Initial sort direction, either YAHOO.widget.DataTable.CLASS_ASC or YAHOO.widget.DataTable.CLASS_DESC</dd>
</dl>

dynamicData.description:
If true, sorting and pagination are relegated to the DataSource
for handling, using the request returned by the "generateRequest" function.
Each new DataSource response blows away all previous Records. False by default, so 
sorting and pagination will be handled directly on the client side, without
causing any new requests for data from the DataSource.

caption.description:
Value for the CAPTION element. NB: Not supported in
ScrollingDataTable.

draggableColumns.description:
True if Columns are draggable to reorder, false otherwise.
The Drag & Drop Utility is required to enable this feature. Only top-level
and non-nested Columns are draggable. Write once.

currencyOptions.description: Default config passed to YAHOO.util.Number.format() by the 'currency' Column formatter.

MSG_SORTDESC.description: Message to display in tooltip to sort Column in descending order.

MSG_LOADING.description: Message to display while DataTable is loading data.

dateOptions.description: Default config passed to YAHOO.util.Date.format() by the 'date' Column formatter.

selectionMode.description:
Specifies row or cell selection mode. Accepts the following strings:
<dl>
<dt>"standard"</dt>
<dd>Standard row selection with support for modifier keys to enable
multiple selections.</dd>
<dt>"single"</dt>
<dd>Row selection with modifier keys disabled to not allow
multiple selections.</dd>
<dt>"singlecell"</dt>
<dd>Cell selection with modifier keys disabled to not allow
multiple selections.</dd>
<dt>"cellblock"</dt>
<dd>Cell selection with support for modifier keys to enable multiple
selections in a block-fashion, like a spreadsheet.</dd>
<dt>"cellrange"</dt>
<dd>Cell selection with support for modifier keys to enable multiple
selections in a range-fashion, like a calendar.</dd>
</dl>

MSG_EMPTY.description: Message to display if DataTable has no data.

MSG_ERROR.description: Message to display while DataTable has data error.

MSG_SORTASC.description: Message to display in tooltip to sort Column in ascending order.

generateRequest.description:
A function that converts an object literal of desired DataTable
states into a request value which is then passed to the DataSource's
sendRequest method in order to retrieve data for those states. This
function is passed an object literal of state data and a reference to the
DataTable instance:
<dl>
<dt>pagination<dt>
<dd>        
<dt>offsetRecord</dt>
<dd>{Number} Index of the first Record of the desired page</dd>
<dt>rowsPerPage</dt>
<dd>{Number} Number of rows per page</dd>
</dd>
<dt>sortedBy</dt>
<dd>                
<dt>key</dt>
<dd>{String} Key of sorted Column</dd>
<dt>dir</dt>
<dd>{String} Sort direction, either YAHOO.widget.DataTable.CLASS_ASC or YAHOO.widget.DataTable.CLASS_DESC</dd>
</dd>
<dt>self</dt>
<dd>The DataTable instance</dd>
</dl>
and by default returns a String of syntax:
"sort={sortColumn}&dir={sortDir}&startIndex={pageStartIndex}&results={rowsPerPage}"

from all TD elements in the internal tracker.

_setColumnWidthDynStyles.description:
Updates width of a Column's liner DIV elements by dynamically creating a
STYLE node and writing and updating CSS style rules to it. If this fails during
runtime, the fallback method _setColumnWidthDynFunction() will be called.
Notes: This technique is not performant in IE6. IE7 crashes if DataTable is
nested within another TABLE element. For these cases, it is recommended to
use the method _setColumnWidthDynFunction by setting _bDynStylesFallback to TRUE.
