fireKeyEvent.description:
Fires an event that normally would be fired by the keyboard (keyup,
keydown, keypress). Make sure to specify either keyCode or charCode as
an option.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of event ("keyup", "keydown" or "keypress").

params.name: target
params.description: The target of the event.

params.name: options
params.description:
Options for the event. Either keyCode or charCode
are required.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to click on.

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of event to fire. This can be any one of
the following: click, dblclick, mousedown, mouseup, mouseout,
mouseover, and mousemove.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

mouseEvent.description: Simulates a mouse event on a particular element.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

keypress.description: Simulates a keypress on a particular element.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

keyup.description: Simulates a keyup event on a particular element.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

mouseup.description: Simulates a mouseup on a particular element.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

keydown.description: Simulates a keydown event on a particular element.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

mousemove.description: Simulates a mousemove on a particular element.

simulateMouseEvent.description:
Simulates a mouse event using the given event information to populate
the generated event object. This method does browser-equalizing
calculations to account for differences in the DOM and IE event models
as well as different browser quirks.

params.name: target
params.description: The target of the given event.

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of event to fire. This can be any one of
the following: click, dblclick, mousedown, mouseup, mouseout,
mouseover, and mousemove.

params.name: bubbles
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if the event can be
bubbled up. DOM Level 2 specifies that all mouse events bubble by
default. The default is true.

params.name: cancelable
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if the event can be
canceled using preventDefault(). DOM Level 2 specifies that all
mouse events except mousemove can be cancelled. The default 
is true for all events except mousemove, for which the default 
is false.

params.name: view
params.description:
(Optional) The view containing the target. This is
typically the window object. The default is window.

params.name: detail
params.description:
(Optional) The number of times the mouse button has
been used. The default value is 1.

params.name: screenX
params.description:
(Optional) The x-coordinate on the screen at which
point the event occured. The default is 0.

params.name: screenY
params.description:
(Optional) The y-coordinate on the screen at which
point the event occured. The default is 0.

params.name: clientX
params.description:
(Optional) The x-coordinate on the client at which
point the event occured. The default is 0.

params.name: clientY
params.description:
(Optional) The y-coordinate on the client at which
point the event occured. The default is 0.

params.name: ctrlKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the CTRL keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: altKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the ALT keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: shiftKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the SHIFT keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: metaKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the META keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: button
params.description:
(Optional) The button being pressed while the event
is executing. The value should be 0 for the primary mouse button
(typically the left button), 1 for the terciary mouse button
(typically the middle button), and 2 for the secondary mouse button
(typically the right button). The default is 0.

params.name: relatedTarget
params.description:
(Optional) For mouseout events,
this is the element that the mouse has moved to. For mouseover
events, this is the element that the mouse has moved from. This
argument is ignored for all other events. The default is null.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

mousedown.description: Simulates a mousedown on a particular element.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

mouseout.description:
Simulates a mouseout event on a particular element. Use "relatedTarget"
on the options object to specify where the mouse moved to.
Quirks: Firefox less than 2.0 doesn't set relatedTarget properly, so
toElement is assigned in its place. IE doesn't allow toElement to be
be assigned, so relatedTarget is assigned in its place. Both of these
concessions allow YAHOO.util.Event.getRelatedTarget() to work correctly
in both browsers.

simulateKeyEvent.description:
Simulates a key event using the given event information to populate
the generated event object. This method does browser-equalizing
calculations to account for differences in the DOM and IE event models
as well as different browser quirks. Note: keydown causes Safari 2.x to
crash.

params.name: target
params.description: The target of the given event.

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of event to fire. This can be any one of
the following: keyup, keydown, and keypress.

params.name: bubbles
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if the event can be
bubbled up. DOM Level 3 specifies that all key events bubble by
default. The default is true.

params.name: cancelable
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if the event can be
canceled using preventDefault(). DOM Level 3 specifies that all
key events can be cancelled. The default 
is true.

params.name: view
params.description:
(Optional) The view containing the target. This is
typically the window object. The default is window.

params.name: ctrlKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the CTRL keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: altKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the ALT keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: shiftKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the SHIFT keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: metaKey
params.description:
(Optional) Indicates if one of the META keys
is pressed while the event is firing. The default is false.

params.name: keyCode
params.description:
(Optional) The code for the key that is in use. 
The default is 0.

params.name: charCode
params.description:
(Optional) The Unicode code for the character
associated with the key being used. The default is 0.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to act on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

mouseover.description:
Simulates a mouseover event on a particular element. Use "relatedTarget"
on the options object to specify where the mouse moved from.
Quirks: Firefox less than 2.0 doesn't set relatedTarget properly, so
fromElement is assigned in its place. IE doesn't allow fromElement to be
be assigned, so relatedTarget is assigned in its place. Both of these
concessions allow YAHOO.util.Event.getRelatedTarget() to work correctly
in both browsers.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to click on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

click.description: Simulates a click on a particular element.

params.name: target
params.description: The element to double click on.

params.name: options
params.description: Additional event options (use DOM standard names).

dblclick.description: Simulates a double click on a particular element.

YAHOO.util.UserAction.description:
The UserAction object provides functions that simulate events occurring in
the browser. Since these are simulated events, they do not behave exactly
as regular, user-initiated events do, but can be used to test simple
user interactions safely.

YAHOO.widget.Menu.name: YAHOO.widget.Menu

constraintoviewport.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu will try to remain inside 
the boundaries of the size of viewport.  This property is only applied 
when the "position" configuration property is set to dynamic and is 
automatically applied to all submenus.

maxheight.description: Number defining the maximum height (in pixels) for a menu's body element (<div class="bd">). Once a menu's body exceeds this height, the contents of the body are scrolled to maintain this value. This value cannot be set lower than the value of the "minscrollheight" configuration property.

classname.description: String representing the CSS class to be applied to the menu's root <div> element. The specified class(es) are appended in addition to the default class as specified by the menu's CSS_CLASS_NAME constant. When set this property is automatically applied to all submenus.

visible.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the menu is visible. If the menu's "position" configuration property is set to "dynamic" (the default), this property toggles the menu's <div> element's "visibility" style property between "visible" (true) or "hidden" (false). If the menu's "position" configuration property is set to "static" this property toggles the menu's <div> element's "display" style property between "block" (true) or "none" (false).

xy.description:
Array of the absolute x and y positions of the Menu.  This 
property is only applied when the "position" configuration property is 
set to dynamic.

container.description:
HTML element reference or string specifying the id 
attribute of the HTML element that the menu's markup should be 
rendered into.

scrollincrement.description:
Number used to control the scroll speed of a menu.  Used to 
increment the "scrollTop" property of the menu's body by when a menu's 
content is scrolling.  When set this property is automatically applied 
to all submenus.

minscrollheight.description:
Number defining the minimum threshold for the "maxheight" 
configuration property.  When set this property is automatically applied 
to all submenus.

fixedcenter.description:
Boolean indicating if the Menu should be anchored to the 
center of the viewport.  This property is only applied when the 
"position" configuration property is set to dynamic.

autosubmenudisplay.description:
Boolean indicating if submenus are automatically made 
visible when the user mouses over the menu's items.

context.description:
Array of context arguments for context-sensitive positioning.  
The format is: [id or element, element corner, context corner]. 
For example, setting this property to ["img1", "tl", "bl"] would 
align the Menu's top left corner to the context element's 
bottom left corner.  This property is only applied when the "position" 
configuration property is set to dynamic.

keepopen.description: Boolean indicating if the menu should remain open when clicked.

clicktohide.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu will automatically be 
hidden if the user clicks outside of it.  This property is only 
applied when the "position" configuration property is set to dynamic 
and is automatically applied to all submenus.

submenualignment.description:
Array defining how submenus should be aligned to their 
parent menu item. The format is: [itemCorner, submenuCorner]. By default
a submenu's top left corner is aligned to its parent menu item's top 
right corner.

disabled.description: Boolean indicating if the menu should be disabled. Disabling a menu disables each of its items. (Disabled menu items are dimmed and will not respond to user input or fire events.) Disabled menus have a corresponding "disabled" CSS class applied to their root <div> element.

effect.description:
Object or array of objects representing the ContainerEffect 
classes that are active for animating the container.  When set this 
property is automatically applied to all submenus.

showdelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should 
expire before a submenu is made visible when the user mouses over 
the menu's items.  This property is only applied when the "position" 
configuration property is set to dynamic and is automatically applied 
to all submenus.

preventcontextoverlap.description:
Boolean indicating whether or not a submenu should overlap its parent MenuItem 
when the "constraintoviewport" configuration property is set to "true".

x.description:
Number representing the absolute x-coordinate position of 
the Menu.  This property is only applied when the "position" 
configuration property is set to dynamic.

shadow.description: Boolean indicating if the menu should have a shadow.

hidedelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should 
expire before the menu is hidden.  This property is only applied when 
the "position" configuration property is set to dynamic and is 
automatically applied to all submenus.

submenuhidedelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should 
expire before a submenu is hidden when the user mouses out of a menu item 
heading in the direction of a submenu.  The value must be greater than or 
equal to the value specified for the "showdelay" configuration property.
This property is only applied when the "position" configuration property 
is set to dynamic and is automatically applied to all submenus.

iframe.default: true for IE6 and below, false for all other browsers.
iframe.description:
Boolean indicating whether or not the Menu should 
have an IFRAME shim; used to prevent SELECT elements from 
poking through an Overlay instance in IE6.  When set to "true", 
the iframe shim is created when the Menu instance is intially
made visible.  This property is only applied when the "position" 
configuration property is set to dynamic and is automatically applied 
to all submenus.

y.description:
Number representing the absolute y-coordinate position of 
the Menu.  This property is only applied when the "position" 
configuration property is set to dynamic.

position.description:
String indicating how a menu should be positioned on the 
screen.  Possible values are "static" and "dynamic."  Static menus are 
visible by default and reside in the normal flow of the document 
(CSS position: static).  Dynamic menus are hidden by default, reside 
out of the normal flow of the document (CSS position: absolute), and 
can overlay other elements on the screen.

constructors.description:
The Menu class creates a container that holds a vertical list representing 
a set of options or commands.  Menu is the base class for all 
menu containers.

mouseOutEvent.description:
Fires when the mouse has left the menu.  Passes back the DOM 
Event object as an argument.

mouseUpEvent.description:
Fires when the user releases a mouse button while the mouse is 
over the menu.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

keyUpEvent.description:
Fires when the user releases a key when one of the menu's items 
has focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

keyPressEvent.description:
Fires when the user presses an alphanumeric key when one of the
menu's items has focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

itemAddedEvent.description: Fires when an item is added to the menu.

mouseOverEvent.description:
Fires when the mouse has entered the menu.  Passes back 
the DOM Event object as an argument.

itemRemovedEvent.description: Fires when an item is removed to the menu.

mouseDownEvent.description:
Fires when the user mouses down on the menu.  Passes back the 
DOM Event object as an argument.

clickEvent.description:
Fires when the user clicks the on the menu.  Passes back the 
DOM Event object as an argument.

keyDownEvent.description:
Fires when the user presses a key when one of the menu's items 
has focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

Change event listener for the "width" configuration property.  This listener is 
added when a Menu's "width" configuration property is set by the "_setScrollHeight" method, and 
is used to set the "_widthSetForScroll" property to "false" if the "width" configuration property 
is changed after it was set by the "_setScrollHeight" method.  If the "_widthSetForScroll" 
property is set to "false", and the "_setScrollHeight" method is in the process of tearing down 
scrolling functionality, it will maintain the Menu's new width rather than reseting it.

configPosition.description:
Event handler for when the "position" configuration property 
of the menu changes.

initDefaultConfig.description:
Initializes the class's configurable properties which can be
changed using the menu's Config object ("cfg").

_execHideDelay.description:
Hides the menu after the number of milliseconds specified by 
the "hidedelay" configuration property.

activeItem.description: Object reference to the item in the menu that has is selected.

CSS_CLASS_NAME.description: String representing the CSS class(es) to be applied to the menu's <div> element.

lazyLoad.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu's "lazy load" feature is 
enabled.  If set to "true," initialization and rendering of the menu's 
items will be deferred until the first time it is made visible.  This 
property should be set via the constructor using the configuration 
object literal.

parent.description:
Object reference to the menu's parent menu or menu item.  
This property can be set via the constructor using the configuration 
object literal.

_bStopMouseEventHandlers.description:
Stops "mouseover," "mouseout," and "mousemove" event handlers 
from executing.

_bHandledMouseOverEvent.description:
Boolean indicating the current state of the menu's 
"mouseover" event.

srcElement.description: Object reference to the HTML element (either <select> or <div>) used to create the menu.

_bHandledMouseOutEvent.description:
Boolean indicating the current state of the menu's
"mouseout" event.

_sClassName.description: The current value of the "classname" configuration attribute.

ITEM_TYPE.description: Object representing the type of menu item to instantiate and add when parsing the child nodes (either <li> element, <optgroup> element or <option>) of the menu's source HTML element.

itemData.description:
Array of items to be added to the menu.  The array can contain 
strings representing the text for each item to be created, object literals 
representing the menu item configuration properties, or MenuItem instances.  
This property should be set via the constructor using the configuration 
object literal.

GROUP_TITLE_TAG_NAME.description:
String representing the tagname of the HTML element used to 
title the menu's item groups.

_aGroupTitleElements.description: Array of HTML element used to title groups of menu items.

_aListElements.description: Array of <ul> elements, each of which is the parent node for each item's <li> element.

_useHideDelay.description:
Boolean indicating if the "mouseover" and "mouseout" event 
handlers used for hiding the menu via a call to "YAHOO.lang.later" have 
already been assigned.

_nCurrentMouseX.description:
The current x coordinate of the mouse inside the area of 
the menu.

_aItemGroups.description:
Multi-dimensional Array representing the menu items as they
are grouped in the menu.

OFF_SCREEN_POSITION.description:
Array representing the default x and y position that a menu 
should have when it is positioned outside the viewport by the 
"poistionOffScreen" method.

YAHOO.widget.Menu.description:
The Menu class creates a container that holds a vertical list representing 
a set of options or commands.  Menu is the base class for all 
menu containers.

YAHOO.widget.Slider.name: YAHOO.widget.Slider

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the element linked to this instance

params.name: sGroup
params.description: The group of related DragDrop items

params.name: oThumb
params.description: The thumb for this slider

params.name: sType
params.description: The type of slider (horiz, vert, region)

constructors.description:
A DragDrop implementation that can be used as a background for a
slider.  It takes a reference to the thumb instance 
so it can delegate some of the events to it.  The goal is to make the 
thumb jump to the location on the background when the background is 
clicked.

slideEnd.description: Event that fires at the end of a slider thumb move

params.name: newOffset|x
params.description:
the new offset for normal sliders, or the new
x offset for region sliders

params.name: y
params.description:
the number of pixels the thumb has moved on the y axis
(region sliders only)

change.description:
Event the fires when the value of the control changes.  If 
the control is animated the event will fire every point
along the way.

slideStart.description: Event that fires at the beginning of a slider thumb move.

return.description: a horizontal dual-thumb slider control

YAHOO.widget.Slider.getHorizDualSlider.description: Factory method for creating a horizontal dual-thumb slider

params.name: bg
params.description: the id of the slider's background element

params.name: minthumb
params.description: the id of the min thumb

params.name: maxthumb
params.description: the id of the thumb thumb

params.name: range
params.description: the number of pixels the thumbs can move within

params.name: iTickSize
params.description:
(optional) the element should move this many pixels
at a time

params.name: initVals
params.description: (optional) [min,max] Initial thumb placement

params.name: thumbEvent
params.description:
set to true if this event is fired from an event
that occurred on the thumb.  If it is, the state of the
thumb dd object should be correct.  Otherwise, the event
originated on the background, so the thumb state needs to
be refreshed before proceeding.

fireEvents.description:
Fires the change event if the value has been changed.  Ignored if we are in
the middle of an animation as the event will fire when the animation is
complete

return.description: a horizontal slider control

params.description: the number of pixels the element can move right

params.description:
optional parameter for specifying that the element 
should move a certain number pixels at a time.

Try to focus the element when clicked so we can add
accessibility features

return.description: true if the move was performed, false if it failed

_setValue.description:
Worker function to execute the value set operation.  Accepts type of
set operation in addition to the usual setValue params.

params.name: newOffset
params.description:
the number of pixels the thumb should be
positioned away from the initial start point

params.name: skipAnim
params.description:
set to true to disable the animation
for this move action (but not others).

params.name: force
params.description: ignore the locked setting and set value anyway

params.name: silent
params.description: when true, do not fire events

params.name: e

handleKeyDown.description:
Executed when a keydown event happens with the control focused.
Updates the slider value and display when the keypress is an
arrow key, home, or end as long as enableKeys is set to true.

Resets the X and Y contraints for the thumb.  Used in lieu of the thumb
instance's inherited resetConstraints because some logic was not
applicable.

return.description: the current horizontal offset

set to true if this is not terminating
the slider movement

Move the associated slider moved to a timeout to try to get around the 
mousedown stealing moz does when I move the slider element between the 
cursor and the background during the mouseup event

return.description: true if the move was performed, false if it failed

params.name: newOffset

the number of pixels the thumb should be

params.name: sBGElId

params.description: the number of pixels the element can move up

params.name: iDown
params.description: the number of pixels the element can move down

params.name: iTickSize
params.description:
optional parameter for specifying that the element 
should move a certain number pixels at a time.

params.name: e
params.description: the keypress event

handleKeyPress.description:
Executed when a keypress event happens with the control focused.
Prevents the default behavior for navigation keys.  The actual
logic for moving the slider thumb in response to a key event
happens in handleKeyDown.

setStartSliderState.description: Initialization that sets up the value offsets once the elements are ready

return.description: the current value

getValue.description: Returns the slider's thumb offset from the start position

b4MouseDown.description: Resets the constraints before moving the thumb.

return.description: a vertical dual-thumb slider control

YAHOO.widget.Slider.getVertDualSlider.description: Factory method for creating a vertical dual-thumb slider.

params.name: bg
params.description: the id of the slider's background element

params.name: minthumb
params.description: the id of the min thumb

params.name: maxthumb
params.description: the id of the thumb thumb

params.name: range
params.description: the number of pixels the thumbs can move within

params.name: iTickSize
params.description:
(optional) the element should move this many pixels
at a time

params.name: initVals
params.description: (optional) [min,max] Initial thumb placement

_getNextY.description: Returns the next Y tick value based on the current coord and the target coord.

_getNextX.description: Returns the next X tick value based on the current coord and the target coord.

keyIncrement.description:
Specifies the number of pixels the arrow keys will move the slider.
Default is 20.

_silent.description:
Indicates whether or not events will be supressed for the current
slide operation

backgroundEnabled.description: Set to false to disable a background click thumb move

animationDuration.description:
If animation is configured, specifies the length of the animation
in seconds.

animate.description: Flag that determines if the thumb will animate when moved

moveComplete.description:
moveComplete is set to true when the slider has moved to its final
destination.  For animated slider, this value can be checked in 
the onChange handler to make it possible to execute logic only
when the move is complete rather than at all points along the way.
Deprecated because this flag is only useful when the background is
clicked and the slider is animated.  If the user drags the thumb,
the flag is updated when the drag is over ... the final onDrag event
fires before the mouseup the ends the drag, so the implementer will
never see it.

thumb.description:
A YAHOO.widget.SliderThumb instance that we will use to 
reposition the thumb when the background is clicked

SOURCE_SET_VALUE.description:
Constant for valueChangeSource, indicating that the value was altered
by a programmatic call to setValue/setRegionValue.

SOURCE_UI_EVENT.description:
Constant for valueChangeSource, indicating that the user clicked or
dragged the slider to change the value.

_mouseDown.description: Tracks the state of the mouse button to aid in when events are fired.

Slider.ANIM_AVAIL.description: By default, animation is available if the animation utility is detected.

Slider.SOURCE_UI_EVENT.description:
Constant for valueChangeSource, indicating that the user clicked or
dragged the slider to change the value.

type.description: The type of the slider (horiz, vert, region)

enableKeys.description: Enables the arrow, home and end keys, defaults to true.

isTarget.description: Overrides the isTarget property in YAHOO.util.DragDrop

baselinePos.description:
The basline position of the background element, used
to determine if the background has moved since the last
operation.

dragOnly.description: Override the default setting of dragOnly to true.

lastOffset.description:
Saved offset used to protect against NaN problems when slider is
set to display:none

thumbCenterPoint.description:
The center of the slider element is stored so we can 
place it in the correct position when the background is clicked.

Slider.SOURCE_SET_VALUE.description:
Constant for valueChangeSource, indicating that the value was altered
by a programmatic call to setValue/setRegionValue.

Slider.SOURCE_KEY_EVENT.description:
Constant for valueChangeSource, indicating that the value was altered
by hitting any of the supported keyboard characters.

valueChangeSource.description:
When the slider value changes, this property is set to identify where
the update came from.  This will be either 1, meaning the slider was
clicked or dragged, or 2, meaning that it was set via a setValue() call.
This can be used within event handlers to apply some of the logic only
when dealing with one source or another.

tickPause.description:
Adjustment factor for tick animation, the more ticks, the
faster the animation (by default)

YAHOO.widget.Slider.description:
A DragDrop implementation that can be used as a background for a
slider.  It takes a reference to the thumb instance 
so it can delegate some of the events to it.  The goal is to make the 
thumb jump to the location on the background when the background is 
clicked.

YAHOO.widget.LayoutUnit.name: YAHOO.widget.LayoutUnit

dataTimeout.description: Number if milliseconds before aborting and calling failure handler.

grids.description: Set this option to true if you want the LayoutUnit to fix the first layer of YUI CSS Grids (margins)

header.description: The text to use as the Header of the Unit

wrap.description: A reference to the wrap element

close.description: Adds a close icon to the unit

animate.description: Use animation to collapse/expand the unit

collapseSize.description: The pixel size of the Clip that we will collapse to

top.description: The current top positioning of the Unit

minWidth.description: The minWidth parameter passed to the Resize Utility

maxWidth.description: The maxWidth parameter passed to the Resize Utility

body.description: The content for the body. If we find an element in the page with an id that matches the passed option we will move that element into the body of this unit.

hover.description: Config option to pass to the Resize Utility

collapse.description: Adds a collapse icon to the unit

parent.description: The parent Layout that we are assigned to

duration.description: The duration to give the Animation Utility when animating the opening and closing of Units

minHeight.description: The minHeight parameter passed to the Resize Utility

dataSrc.description: The unit data source, used for loading content dynamically.

zIndex.description: The CSS zIndex to give to the unit, so you can have overlapping elements such as menus in a unit.

proxy.description: Use the proxy config setting for the Resize Utility

position.description: The position (top, right, bottom, left or center) of the Unit in the Layout

dataLoaded.description: Whether or not any data has been loaded from the server.

resize.description: Should a Resize instance be added to this unit

gutter.description: The gutter that we should apply to the parent Layout around this Unit. Supports standard CSS markup: (2 4 0 5) or (2) or (2 5)

footer.description: The content for the footer. If we find an element in the page with an id that matches the passed option we will move that element into the footer of this unit.

useShim.description: Config option to pass to the Resize Utility

loadMethod.description: The method to use for the data request.

maxHeight.description: The maxHeight parameter passed to the Resize Utility

easing.description: The Animation Easing to apply to the Animation instance for this unit.

scroll.description: Adds a class to the unit to allow for overflow: auto (yui-layout-scroll), default is overflow: hidden (yui-layout-noscroll). If true scroll bars will be placed on the element when the content exceeds the given area, false will put overflow hidden to hide the content. Passing null will render the content as usual overflow.

left.description: The current left position of the Unit

params.description: The element to make a unit.

params.name: attrs
params.description: Object liternal containing configuration parameters.

YAHOO.widget.NumericAxis.name: YAHOO.widget.NumericAxis

constructors.description: A type of axis whose units are measured in numeric values.

scale.description: The scaling algorithm to use on this axis. May be "linear" or "logarithmic".

stackingEnabled.description: Series that are stackable will only stack when this value is set to true.

calculateByLabelSize.description: Indicates whether to factor in the size of the labels when calculating a major unit.

maximum.description:
The maximum value drawn by the axis. If not set explicitly, the axis maximum
will be calculated automatically.

adjustMaximumByMajorUnit.description:
Indicates whether to extend maximum beyond data's maximum to the nearest 
majorUnit.

minorUnit.description: The spacing between minor intervals on this axis.

minimum.description:
The minimum value drawn by the axis. If not set explicitly, the axis minimum
will be calculated automatically.

majorUnit.description: The spacing between major intervals on this axis.

adjustMinimumByMajorUnit.description:
Indicates whether to extend the minimum beyond data's minimum to the nearest
majorUnit.

snapToUnits.description:
If true, the labels, ticks, gridlines, and other objects will snap to
the nearest major or minor unit. If false, their position will be based
on the minimum value.

position.description: Indicates the position of the axis relative to the chart

roundMajorUnit.description: Indicates whether to round the major unit.

alwaysShowZero.description:
If true, and the bounds are calculated automatically, either the minimum or
maximum will be set to zero.

YAHOO.widget.NumericAxis.description: A type of axis whose units are measured in numeric values.

YAHOO.widget.Uploader.name: YAHOO.widget.Uploader

params.name: containerId
params.description: Container element for the Flash Player instance.

params.name: buttonSkin
params.description:
[optional]. If defined, the uploader is 
rendered as a button. This parameter must provide the URL of a button
skin sprite image. Acceptable types are: jpg, gif, png and swf. The 
sprite is divided evenly into four sections along its height (e.g., if
the sprite is 200 px tall, it's divided into four sections 50px each).
Each section is used as a skin for a specific state of the button: top
section is "up", second section is "over", third section is "down", and
fourth section is "disabled". 
If the parameter is not supplied, the uploader is rendered transparent,
and it's the developer's responsibility to create a visible UI below it.

params.name: forceTransparent
params.description:
This parameter, if true, forces the Flash
UI to be rendered with wmode set to "transparent". This behavior is useful 
in conjunction with non-rectangular button skins with PNG transparency. 
The parameter is false by default, and ignored if no buttonSkin is defined.

constructors.description: Uploader class for the YUI Uploader component.

params.name: uploadScriptPath
params.description: The URL of the upload location.

params.name: method
params.description: Either "GET" or "POST", specifying how the variables accompanying the file upload POST request should be submitted. "GET" by default.

params.name: vars
params.description: The object containing variables to be sent in the same request as the file upload.

params.name: fieldName
params.description: The name of the variable in the POST request containing the file data. "Filedata" by default.

uploadAll.description: Starts uploading all files in the queue. If this function is called, the upload queue is automatically managed.

enable.description:
Enables the mouse events on the Uploader.
If the uploader is being rendered as a button,
then the button's skin is set to "up"
(first section of the button skin sprite).

params.name: allowLogging
params.description: If true, logs are output; otherwise, no logs are produced.

setAllowLogging.description:
Turns the logging functionality on.
Uses Flash internal trace logging, as well as YUI Logger, if available.

clearFileList.description: Clears the list of files queued for upload.

params.name: fileID
params.description: The id of the file to start uploading.

params.name: uploadScriptPath
params.description: The URL of the upload location.

params.name: method
params.description: Either "GET" or "POST", specifying how the variables accompanying the file upload POST request should be submitted. "GET" by default.

params.name: vars
params.description: The object containing variables to be sent in the same request as the file upload.

params.name: fieldName
params.description: The name of the variable in the POST request containing the file data. "Filedata" by default.

upload.description: Starts the upload of the file specified by fileID to the location specified by uploadScriptPath.

params.name: fileID
params.description: The id of the file to remove from the upload queue.

removeFile.description: Removes the specified file from the upload queue.

params.name: simUploadLimit
params.description: Number of simultaneous uploads, between 1 and 5.

setSimUploadLimit.description:
Sets the number of simultaneous uploads when using uploadAll()
The minimum value is 1, and maximum value is 5. The default value is 2.

disable.description:
Disables the mouse events on the Uploader.
If the uploader is being rendered as a button,
then the button's skin is set to "disabled"
(fourth section of the button skin sprite).

params.name: allowMultipleFiles
params.description: If true, multiple files can be selected. False by default.

setAllowMultipleFiles.description: Sets the flag allowing users to select multiple files for the upload.

params.name: fileIDs
params.description: The ids of the files to start uploading.

params.name: uploadScriptPath
params.description: The URL of the upload location.

params.name: method
params.description: Either "GET" or "POST", specifying how the variables accompanying the file upload POST request should be submitted. "GET" by default.

params.name: vars
params.description: The object containing variables to be sent in the same request as the file upload.

params.name: fieldName
params.description: The name of the variable in the POST request containing the file data. "Filedata" by default.

uploadThese.description: Starts the upload of the files specified by fileIDs, or adds them to a currently running queue. The upload queue is automatically managed.

params.name: fileID
params.description: The ID of the file whose upload should be cancelled.

cancel.description: Cancels the upload of a specified file. If no file id is specified, all ongoing uploads are cancelled.

params.name: newFilterArray
params.description:
An array of sets of key-value pairs of the form

The extensions string is a semicolon-delimited list of elements of the form "*.xxx", 
e.g. "*.jpg;*.gif;*.png".

stopDrag.description:
Ends the current drag, cleans up the state, and fires the endDrag
and mouseUp events.  Called internally when a mouseup is detected
during the drag.  Can be fired manually during the drag by passing
either another event (such as the mousemove event received in onDrag)
or a fake event with pageX and pageY defined (so that endDrag and
onMouseUp have usable position data.).  Alternatively, pass true
for the silent parameter so that the endDrag and onMouseUp events
are skipped (so no event data is needed.)

mouse click.

if the element that generated the mousedown event is actually the 
handle and not the html element itself.

location of the cursor during the drag/drop

drag and drop linked element constantly during a drag.

not the mouse move threshold.

drag if we don't get a mouseup event. Default=1000

The X position of the mousedown event stored for later use when a 
drag threshold is met.

startY.description:
The Y position of the mousedown event stored for later use when a 
drag threshold is met.

_shim.description: The HTML element created to use as a shim over the document to track mouse movements

_debugShim.description: This property is used when useShim is set to true, it will set the opacity on the shim to .5 for debugging. Use: (YAHOO.util.DDM._debugShim = true;)

STRICT_INTERSECT.description:
In intersect mode, drag and drop interaction is defined only by the 
overlap of two or more drag and drop objects.

interactionInfo.description:
Provides additional information about the the current set of
interactions.  Can be accessed from the event handlers. It
contains the following properties:
out:       onDragOut interactions
enter:     onDragEnter interactions
over:      onDragOver interactions
drop:      onDragDrop interactions
point:     The location of the cursor
draggedRegion: The location of dragged element at the time
of the interaction
sourceRegion: The location of the source elemtn at the time
of the interaction
validDrop: boolean

locationCache.description:
Location cache that is set for all drag drop objects when a drag is
initiated, cleared when the drag is finished.

INTERSECT.description:
In intersect mode, drag and drop interaction is defined by the 
cursor position or the amount of overlap of two or more drag and 
drop objects.

_shimState.description: This property is used when useShim is set on a DragDrop object to store the current state of DDM.useShim so it can be reset when a drag operation is done.

locked.description: All drag and drop can be disabled.

useShim.description: This property is used to turn on global use of the shim element on all DragDrop instances, defaults to false for backcompat. (Use: YAHOO.util.DDM.useShim = true)

dragCurrent.description: the DragDrop object that is currently being dragged

preventDefault.description:
Flag to determine if we should prevent the default behavior of the
events we define. By default this is true, but this can be set to 
false if you need the default behavior (not recommended)

ids.description:
Two dimensional Array of registered DragDrop objects.  The first 
dimension is the DragDrop item group, the second the DragDrop 
object.

_shimActive.description: This property is used to determine if the shim is active over the screen, default false.

YAHOO.util.DragDropMgr.description:
DragDropMgr is a singleton that tracks the element interaction for 
all DragDrop items in the window.  Generally, you will not call 
this class directly, but it does have helper methods that could 
be useful in your DragDrop implementations.

YAHOO.util.Chain.name: YAHOO.util.Chain

params.name: callback*
params.description: Any number of callbacks to initialize the queue

constructors.description:
Mechanism to execute a series of callbacks in a non-blocking queue. Each callback is executed via setTimout unless configured with a negative timeout, in which case it is run in blocking mode in the same execution thread as the previous callback. Callbacks can be function references or object literals with the following keys:
  • method - {Function} REQUIRED the callback function.
  • scope - {Object} the scope from which to execute the callback. Default is the global window scope.
  • argument - {Array} parameters to be passed to method as individual arguments.
  • timeout - {number} millisecond delay to wait after previous callback completion before executing this callback. Negative values cause immediate blocking execution. Default 0.
  • until - {Function} boolean function executed before each iteration. Return true to indicate completion and proceed to the next callback.
  • iterations - {Number} number of times to execute the callback before proceeding to the next callback in the chain. Incompatible with until.

end.description:
Event fired when the callback queue is emptied via execution (not via
a call to chain.stop().

return.description: the Chain instance

stop.description:
Stop and clear the Chain's queue after the current execution of the
current callback completes.

return.description: the Chain instance

params.name: c
params.description: the callback function ref or object literal

add.description: Add a callback to the end of the queue

return.description: the Chain instance

pause.description:
Pause the execution of the Chain after the current execution of the
current callback completes.  If called interstitially, clears the
timeout for the pending callback. Paused Chains can be restarted with
chain.run()

return.description: the Chain instance

run.description: Begin executing the chain, or resume execution from the last paused position.

id.description: Timeout id used to pause or stop execution and indicate the execution state of the Chain.  0 indicates paused or stopped, -1 indicates blocking execution, and any positive number indicates non-blocking execution.

YAHOO.util.Chain.description:
Mechanism to execute a series of callbacks in a non-blocking queue. Each callback is executed via setTimout unless configured with a negative timeout, in which case it is run in blocking mode in the same execution thread as the previous callback. Callbacks can be function references or object literals with the following keys:
  • method - {Function} REQUIRED the callback function.
  • scope - {Object} the scope from which to execute the callback. Default is the global window scope.
  • argument - {Array} parameters to be passed to method as individual arguments.
  • timeout - {number} millisecond delay to wait after previous callback completion before executing this callback. Negative values cause immediate blocking execution. Default 0.
  • until - {Function} boolean function executed before each iteration. Return true to indicate completion and proceed to the next callback.
  • iterations - {Number} number of times to execute the callback before proceeding to the next callback in the chain. Incompatible with until.

YAHOO.widget.ProgressBar.name: YAHOO.widget.ProgressBar

direction.description:
Direction of movement of the bar.  
It can be any of 'ltr' (left to right), 'rtl' (the reverse) , 'ttb' (top to bottom) or 'btt'.
Can only be set once and only before rendering.

anim.description: it accepts either a boolean (recommended) or an instance of YAHOO.util.Anim. If a boolean, it will enable/disable animation creating its own instance of the animation utility. If given an instance of YAHOO.util.Anim it will use that instance. The animation utility needs to be loaded. When read, it returns the instance of the animation utility in use or null if none. It can be used to set the animation parameters such as easing methods or duration.

maxValue.description:
Represents the top value for the bar. 
The bar will be fully extended when reaching this value.  
Values higher than this will be ignored.

value.description:
The value for the bar.  
Valid values are in between the minValue and maxValue attributes.

minValue.description:
Represents the lowest value for the bar. 
The bar will be totally collapsed when reaching this value.  
Values lower than this will be ignored.

width.description:
Width of the ProgressBar.
If a number, it will be assumed to be in pixels.  
If a string it should be a valid setting for the CSS width attribute.  
It will always be returned as a string including units.

barEl.description: Reference to the HTML object that makes the moving bar (read-only)

height.description:
Height of the ProgressBar.
If a number, it will be assumed to be in pixels.  
If a string it should be a valid setting for the CSS height attribute.  
It will always be returned as a string including units.

maskEl.description: Reference to the HTML object that overlays the bar providing the mask. (read-only)

params.name: oConfigs
params.description: An object containing any configuration attributes to be set

constructors.description:
The ProgressBar widget provides an easy way to draw a bar depicting progress of an operation,
a level meter, rating or any such simple linear measure.
It allows for highly customized styles including animation, vertical or horizontal and forward or reverse.

render.description:
Renders the ProgressBar into the given container.  
If the container has other content, the ProgressBar will be appended to it.
If the second argument is provided, the ProgressBar will be inserted before the given child.
The method is chainable since it returns a reference to this instance.

_fixEdges.description:
Due to rounding differences, some browsers fail to cover the whole area 
with the mask quadrants when the width or height is odd.  This method
stretches the lower and/or right quadrants to make the difference.

_barSizeFunctions.description:

YAHOO.util.Scroll.name: YAHOO.util.Scroll

params.name: el
params.description: Reference to the element that will be animated

params.name: attributes
params.description:
The attribute(s) to be animated.  
Each attribute is an object with at minimum a "to" or "by" member defined.  
Additional optional members are "from" (defaults to current value), "units" (defaults to "px").  
All attribute names use camelCase.

params.name: duration
params.description: (optional, defaults to 1 second) Length of animation (frames or seconds), defaults to time-based

params.name: method
params.description: (optional, defaults to YAHOO.util.Easing.easeNone) Computes the values that are applied to the attributes per frame (generally a YAHOO.util.Easing method)

constructors.description:
Anim subclass for scrolling elements to a position defined by the "scroll" member of "attributes". All "scroll" members are arrays with x, y scroll positions.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Scroll(el, { scroll: { to: [0, 800] } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

YAHOO.util.Scroll.description:
Anim subclass for scrolling elements to a position defined by the "scroll" member of "attributes". All "scroll" members are arrays with x, y scroll positions.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Scroll(el, { scroll: { to: [0, 800] } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

YAHOO.widget.Dialog.name: YAHOO.widget.Dialog

buttons.description:
Array of object literals, each containing a set of properties defining a button to be appended into the Dialog's footer.

Each button object in the buttons array can have three properties:

text:
The text that will display on the face of the button. The text can include HTML, as long as it is compliant with HTML Button specifications.
handler:
Can be either:
  1. A reference to a function that should fire when the button is clicked. (In this case scope of this function is always its Dialog instance.)
  2. An object literal representing the code to be executed when the button is clicked.

    Format:

    {
    fn: Function, // The handler to call when the event fires.
    obj: Object, // An object to pass back to the handler.
    scope: Object // The object to use for the scope of the handler.
    }

isDefault:
An optional boolean value that specifies that a button should be highlighted and focused by default.
NOTE:If the YUI Button Widget is included on the page, the buttons created will be instances of YAHOO.widget.Button. Otherwise, HTML Buttons (<BUTTON>) will be created.

hideaftersubmit.description:
This property is used to configure whether or not the 
dialog should be automatically hidden after submit.

postdata.description: Any additional post data which needs to be sent when using the async postmethod for dialog POST submissions. The format for the post data string is defined by Connection Manager's asyncRequest method.

postmethod.description:
The method to use for posting the Dialog's form. Possible values 
are "async", "form", and "manual".

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Dialog OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Dialog

params.name: userConfig
params.description:
The configuration object literal containing 
the configuration that should be set for this Dialog. See configuration 
documentation for more details.

constructors.description:
Dialog is an implementation of Panel that can be used to submit form data.

Built-in functionality for buttons with event handlers is included. If the optional YUI Button dependancy is included on the page, the buttons created will be instances of YAHOO.widget.Button, otherwise regular HTML buttons will be created.

Forms can be processed in 3 ways -- via an asynchronous Connection utility call, a simple form POST or GET, or manually. The YUI Connection utility should be included if you're using the default "async" postmethod, but is not required if you're using any of the other postmethod values.

params.name: conn
params.description: The connection object, returned by YAHOO.util.Connect.asyncRequest

asyncSubmitEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after asynchronous submission, before the generic submit event is fired

manualSubmitEvent.description: CustomEvent fired for manual submission, before the generic submit event is fired

formSubmitEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after form-based submission, before the generic submit event is fired

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description:
The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration 
handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description:
The scope object. For configuration handlers, 
this will usually equal the owner.

configButtons.description: The default event handler for the "buttons" configuration property

getButtons.description: Returns an array containing each of the Dialog's buttons, by default an array of HTML <BUTTON> elements. If the Dialog's buttons were created using the YAHOO.widget.Button class (via the inclusion of the optional Button dependancy on the page), an array of YAHOO.widget.Button instances is returned.

doSubmit.description: Submits the Dialog's form depending on the value of the "postmethod" configuration property. Please note: As of version 2.3 this method will automatically handle asyncronous file uploads should the Dialog instance's form contain <input type="file"> elements. If a Dialog instance will be handling asyncronous file uploads, its callback property will need to be setup with a upload handler rather than the standard success and, or failure handlers. For more information, see the Connection Manager documenation on file uploads.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description:
The CustomEvent arguments. For 
configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value 
for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description:
The scope object. For configuration handlers, 
this will usually equal the owner.

configClose.description:
The default event handler fired when the "close" property is 
changed. The method controls the appending or hiding of the close
icon at the top right of the Dialog.

params.name: e
params.description: The DOM Event object

_submitHandler.description: Internal handler for the form submit event

_doClose.description: Event handler for the close icon

cancel.description: Executes the cancel of the Dialog followed by a hide.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description:
The CustomEvent arguments. For 
configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value 
for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description:
The scope object. For configuration handlers, 
this will usually equal the owner.

configPostMethod.description: The default event handler for the "postmethod" configuration property

focusFirstButton.description:
Sets the focus to the first button created via the "buttons"
configuration property.

initEvents.description:
Initializes the custom events for Dialog which are fired 
automatically at appropriate times by the Dialog class.

focusFirst.description:
Sets focus to the first focusable element in the Dialog's form if found, else, the default button if found, else the first button defined via the "buttons" configuration property.

This method is invoked when the Dialog is made visible.

submit.description:
Executes a submit of the Dialog if validation 
is successful. By default the Dialog is hidden
after submission, but you can set the "hideaftersubmit"
configuration property to false, to prevent the Dialog
from being hidden.

focusLastButton.description:
Sets the focus to the last button created via the "buttons" 
configuration property.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Dialog OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Dialog

params.name: userConfig
params.description:
The configuration object literal 
containing the configuration that should be set for this Dialog. 
See configuration documentation for more details.

init.description:
The Dialog initialization method, which is executed for Dialog and 
all of its subclasses. This method is automatically called by the 
constructor, and  sets up all DOM references for pre-existing markup, 
and creates required markup if it is not already present.

return.description: The string representation of the Dialog

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the object.

focusDefaultButton.description:
Sets the focus to the button that is designated as the default via 
the "buttons" configuration property. By default, this method is 
called when the Dialog is made visible.

return.description:
A JSON object reprsenting the data of the 
current form.

getData.description:
Returns a JSON-compatible data structure representing the data 
currently contained in the form.

blurButtons.description:
Blurs all the buttons defined via the "buttons" 
configuration property.

focusLast.description:
Sets focus to the last element in the Dialog's form or the last 
button defined via the "buttons" configuration property.

destroy.description:
Removes the Panel element from the DOM and sets all child elements 
to null.

validate.description:
Built-in function hook for writing a validation function that will 
be checked for a "true" value prior to a submit. This function, as 
implemented by default, always returns true, so it should be 
overridden if validation is necessary.

registerForm.description:
Prepares the Dialog's internal FORM object, creating one if one is
not currently present.

setFirstLastFocusable.description:
Configures instance properties, pointing to the 
first and last focusable elements in the Dialog's form.

return.description: Object literal, with method and action String properties.

_getFormAttributes.description:
Retrieves important attributes (currently method and action) from
the form element, accounting for any elements which may have the same name 
as the attributes. Defaults to "POST" and "" for method and action respectively
if the attribute cannot be retrieved.

params.name: oForm
params.description: The HTML Form element from which to retrieve the attributes

setTabLoop.description:
Sets up a tab, shift-tab loop between the first and last elements
provided. NOTE: Sets up the preventBackTab and preventTabOut KeyListener
instance properties, which are reset everytime this method is invoked.

initDefaultConfig.description:
Initializes the class's configurable properties which can be changed 
using the Dialog's Config object (cfg).

_getButton.description:
Helper method to normalize button references. It either returns the 
YUI Button instance for the given element if found,
or the passes back the HTMLElement reference if a corresponding YUI Button
reference is not found or YAHOO.widget.Button does not exist on the page.

YAHOO.widget.Dialog.CSS_DIALOG.description: Constant representing the default CSS class used for a Dialog

form.description: Object reference to the Dialog's <form> element.

callback.success.description:
The function to execute upon success of the 
Connection submission (when the form does not
contain a file input element).

callback.failure.description:
The function to execute upon failure of the 
Connection submission

callback.description:
The internally maintained callback object for use with the 
Connection utility. The format of the callback object is 
similar to Connection Manager's callback object and is 
simply passed through to Connection Manager when the async 
request is made.

EVENT_TYPES.description: Constant representing the name of the Dialog's events

callback.upload.description:
The function to execute upon success of the Connection submission, when the form contains a file input element.

NOTE: Connection manager will not invoke the success or failure handlers for the file upload use case. This will be the only callback handler invoked.

For more information, see the Connection Manager documenation on file uploads.

DEFAULT_CONFIG.description: Constant representing the Dialog's configuration properties

callback.argument.description:
The arbitraty argument or arguments to pass to the Connection 
callback functions

params.name: bodyContent
params.description: The HTML used to set the body. As a convenience, non HTMLElement objects can also be passed into the method, and will be treated as strings, with the body innerHTML set to their default toString implementations. OR

params.description: The HTMLElement to add as the first and only child of the body element. OR

containing elements which are to be added to the body

setBody.description:
Sets the SimpleDialog's body content to the HTML specified. If no body is present, one will be automatically created. An empty string can be passed to the method to clear the contents of the body.

NOTE: SimpleDialog provides the text and icon configuration properties to set the contents of it's body element in accordance with the UI design for a SimpleDialog (an icon and message text). Calling setBody on the SimpleDialog will not enforce this UI design constraint and will replace the entire contents of the SimpleDialog body. It should only be used if you wish the replace the default icon/text body structure of a SimpleDialog with your own custom markup.

YAHOO.widget.SimpleDialog.description:
SimpleDialog is a simple implementation of Dialog that can be used to 
submit a single value. Forms can be processed in 3 ways -- via an 
asynchronous Connection utility call, a simple form POST or GET, 
or manually.

YAHOO.util.Connect.name: YAHOO.util.Connect

handleReadyState.description:
This method serves as a timer that polls the XHR object's readyState
property during a transaction, instead of binding a callback to the
onreadystatechange event.  Upon readyState 4, handleTransactionResponse
will process the response, and the timer will be cleared.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object

params.name: callback
params.description: The user-defined callback object

return.description: void

setDefaultXhrHeader.description: Member to override the default transaction header..

params.name: b
params.description: Set and use default header - true or false .

return.description: void

setDefaultPostHeader.description: Member to override the default POST header.

params.name: b
params.description: Set and use default header - true or false .

abort.description: Method to terminate a transaction, if it has not reached readyState 4.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object returned by asyncRequest.

params.name: callback
params.description: User-defined callback object.

params.name: isTimeout
params.description: boolean to indicate if abort resulted from a callback timeout.

initHeader.description: Method that initializes the custom HTTP headers for the each transaction.

params.name: label
params.description: The HTTP header label

params.name: value
params.description: The HTTP header value

params.name: isDefault
params.description:
Determines if the specific header is a default header
automatically sent with each transaction.

return.description: void

setPollingInterval.description: Member to modify the default polling interval.

params.name: i
params.description: The polling interval in milliseconds.

getConnectionObject.description:
This method is called by asyncRequest to create a
valid connection object for the transaction.  It also passes a
transaction id and increments the transaction id counter.

createExceptionObject.description:
If a transaction cannot be completed due to dropped or closed connections,
there may be not be enough information to build a full response object.
The failure callback will be fired and this specific condition can be identified
by a status property value of 0.
If an abort was successful, the status property will report a value of -1.

params.name: tId
params.description: The Transaction Id

params.name: callbackArg
params.description: The user-defined argument or arguments to be passed to the callback

params.name: isAbort
params.description: Determines if the exception case is caused by a transaction abort

createResponseObject.description:
This method evaluates the server response, creates and returns the results via
its properties.  Success and failure cases will differ in the response
object's property values.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object

params.name: callbackArg
params.description: The user-defined argument or arguments to be passed to the callback

resetDefaultHeaders.description: Resets the default HTTP headers object

initCustomEvents.description:
This method creates and subscribes custom events,
specific to each transaction

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object

params.name: callback
params.description: The user-defined callback object

isCallInProgress.description: Determines if the transaction is still being processed.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object returned by asyncRequest

return.description: Returns the connection object

asyncRequest.description: Method for initiating an asynchronous request via the XHR object.

params.name: method
params.description: HTTP transaction method

params.name: uri
params.description: Fully qualified path of resource

params.name: callback
params.description: User-defined callback function or object

params.name: postData
params.description: POST body

setHeader.description: Accessor that sets the HTTP headers for each transaction.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object for the transaction.

return.description: void

setProgId.description:
Member to add an ActiveX id to the existing xml_progid array.
In the event(unlikely) a new ActiveX id is introduced, it can be added
without internal code modifications.

params.name: id
params.description: The ActiveX id to be added to initialize the XHR object.

releaseObject.description: Dereference the XHR instance and the connection object after the transaction is completed.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object

return.description: object

createXhrObject.description:
Instantiates a XMLHttpRequest object and returns an object with two properties:
the XMLHttpRequest instance and the transaction id.

params.name: transactionId
params.description: Property containing the transaction id for this transaction.

handleTransactionResponse.description:
This method attempts to interpret the server response and
determine whether the transaction was successful, or if an error or
exception was encountered.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object

params.name: callback
params.description: The user-defined callback object

params.name: isAbort
params.description: Determines if the transaction was terminated via abort().

abortEvent.description: Custom event that fires when a transaction is successfully aborted.

_transaction_id.description: A transaction counter that increments the transaction id for each transaction.

failureEvent.description:
Custom event that fires when handleTransactionResponse() determines a
response in the HTTP 4xx/5xx range.

successEvent.description:
Custom event that fires when handleTransactionResponse() determines a
response in the HTTP 2xx range.

_default_xhr_header.description:
The default header value for the label
"X-Requested-With".  This is sent with each
transaction, by default, to identify the
request as being made by YUI Connection Manager.

_use_default_post_header.description:
Determines if a default header of
Content-Type of 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded'
will be added to any client HTTP headers sent for POST
transactions.

completeEvent.description: Custom event that fires when a transaction response has completed.

_customEvents.description:
A reference table that maps callback custom events members to its specific
event name.

_default_form_header.description:
The default header used for transactions involving the
use of HTML forms.

_use_default_xhr_header.description:
Determines if a default header of
'X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest'
will be added to each transaction.

_has_default_header.description:
Determines if custom, default headers
are set for each transaction.

_poll.description: Collection of polling references to the polling mechanism in handleReadyState.

startEvent.description: Custom event that fires at the start of a transaction

_default_post_header.description: The default header used for POST transactions.

_timeOut.description: Queue of timeout values for each transaction callback with a defined timeout value.

_polling_interval.description:
The polling frequency, in milliseconds, for HandleReadyState.
when attempting to determine a transaction's XHR readyState.
The default is 50 milliseconds.

_has_http_headers.description: Determines if HTTP headers are set.

_msxml_progid.description: Array of MSFT ActiveX ids for XMLHttpRequest.

YAHOO.util.Connect.description:
The Connection Manager singleton provides methods for creating and managing
asynchronous transactions.

YAHOO.widget.FlashAdapter.name: YAHOO.widget.FlashAdapter

altText.description: The alternative text to provide for screen readers and other assistive technology.

version.description:
Minimum required version for the SWF file. Only available in the constructor because it may not be
set after Flash Player has been embedded in the page.

swfURL.description:
Absolute or relative URL to the SWF displayed by the FlashAdapter. Only available in the constructor because it may not be
set after Flash Player has been embedded in the page.

expressInstall.description:
URL pointing to a SWF file that handles Flash Player's express
install feature. Only available in the constructor because it may not be
set after Flash Player has been embedded in the page.

wmode.description:
Sets the window mode of the Flash Player control. May be
"window", "opaque", or "transparent". Only available in the constructor
because it may not be set after Flash Player has been embedded in the page.

backgroundColor.description:
The background color of the SWF. Only available in the constructor because it may not be
set after Flash Player has been embedded in the page.

_swfURL.description: The URL of the SWF file.

_initialized.description:
Indicates whether the SWF has been initialized and is ready
to communicate with JavaScript

_attributes.description: The initializing attributes are stored here until the SWF is ready.

_containerID.description: The ID of the containing DIV.

_swf.description: A reference to the embedded SWF file.

proxyFunctionCount.description: The number of proxy functions that have been created.

_loadHandler.description: Called when the SWF has been initialized.

YAHOO.widget.FlashAdapter.createProxyFun.description:
Creates a globally accessible function that wraps a function reference.
Returns the proxy function's name as a string for use by the SWF through
ExternalInterface.

YAHOO.widget.FlashAdapter.removeProxyFun.description: Removes a function created with createProxyFunction()

return.description: Unique name of the FlashAdapter instance.

toString.description: Public accessor to the unique name of the FlashAdapter instance.

YAHOO.widget.FlashAdapter.eventHandler.description:
Receives event messages from SWF and passes them to the correct instance
of FlashAdapter.

_eventHandler.description: Handles or re-dispatches events received from the SWF.

_embedSWF.description: Embeds the SWF in the page and associates it with this instance.

destroy.description:
Nulls out the entire FlashAdapter instance and related objects and removes attached
event listeners and clears out DOM elements inside the container. After calling
this method, the instance reference should be expliclitly nulled by implementer,
as in myChart = null. Use with caution!

contentReady.description: Fires when the SWF is initialized and communication is possible.

YAHOO.util.Date.name: YAHOO.util.Date

return.description: Formatted date for display.

format.description: Takes a native JavaScript Date and formats to string for display to user.

params.name: oDate
params.description: Date.

params.name: oConfig
params.description:
(Optional) Object literal of configuration values:
format <String>

Any strftime string is supported, such as "%I:%M:%S %p". strftime has several format specifiers defined by the Open group at http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/007908799/xsh/strftime.html

PHP added a few of its own, defined at http://www.php.net/strftime

This javascript implementation supports all the PHP specifiers and a few more. The full list is below:

%a
abbreviated weekday name according to the current locale
%A
full weekday name according to the current locale
%b
abbreviated month name according to the current locale
%B
full month name according to the current locale
%c
preferred date and time representation for the current locale
%C
century number (the year divided by 100 and truncated to an integer, range 00 to 99)
%d
day of the month as a decimal number (range 01 to 31)
%D
same as %m/%d/%y
%e
day of the month as a decimal number, a single digit is preceded by a space (range ' 1' to '31')
%F
same as %Y-%m-%d (ISO 8601 date format)
%g
like %G, but without the century
%G
The 4-digit year corresponding to the ISO week number
%h
same as %b
%H
hour as a decimal number using a 24-hour clock (range 00 to 23)
%I
hour as a decimal number using a 12-hour clock (range 01 to 12)
%j
day of the year as a decimal number (range 001 to 366)
%k
hour as a decimal number using a 24-hour clock (range 0 to 23); single digits are preceded by a blank. (See also %H.)
%l
hour as a decimal number using a 12-hour clock (range 1 to 12); single digits are preceded by a blank. (See also %I.)
%m
month as a decimal number (range 01 to 12)
%M
minute as a decimal number
%n
newline character
%p
either `AM' or `PM' according to the given time value, or the corresponding strings for the current locale
%P
like %p, but lower case
%r
time in a.m. and p.m. notation equal to %I:%M:%S %p
%R
time in 24 hour notation equal to %H:%M
%s
number of seconds since the Epoch, ie, since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC
%S
second as a decimal number
%t
tab character
%T
current time, equal to %H:%M:%S
%u
weekday as a decimal number [1,7], with 1 representing Monday
%U
week number of the current year as a decimal number, starting with the first Sunday as the first day of the first week
%V
The ISO 8601:1988 week number of the current year as a decimal number, range 01 to 53, where week 1 is the first week that has at least 4 days in the current year, and with Monday as the first day of the week.
%w
day of the week as a decimal, Sunday being 0
%W
week number of the current year as a decimal number, starting with the first Monday as the first day of the first week
%x
preferred date representation for the current locale without the time
%X
preferred time representation for the current locale without the date
%y
year as a decimal number without a century (range 00 to 99)
%Y
year as a decimal number including the century
%z
numerical time zone representation
%Z
time zone name or abbreviation
%%
a literal `%' character

params.name: sLocale
params.description:
(Optional) The locale to use when displaying days of week,
months of the year, and other locale specific strings.  The following locales are
built in:
<dl>
<dt>en</dt>
<dd>English</dd>
<dt>en-US</dt>
<dd>US English</dd>
<dt>en-GB</dt>
<dd>British English</dd>
<dt>en-AU</dt>
<dd>Australian English (identical to British English)</dd>
</dl>
More locales may be added by subclassing of YAHOO.util.DateLocale.
See YAHOO.util.DateLocale for more information.

YAHOO.util.Date.description: The static Date class provides helper functions to deal with data of type Date.
