YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.name: YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator

params.name: cal
params.description: The instance of the Calendar or CalendarGroup to which this CalendarNavigator should be attached.

constructors.description:
The CalendarNavigator is used along with a Calendar/CalendarGroup to 
provide a Month/Year popup navigation control, allowing the user to navigate 
to a specific month/year in the Calendar/CalendarGroup without having to 
scroll through months sequentially

return.description:
The month index, or 0 if a UI element for the month
is not found

_getMonthFromUI.description: Returns the month value (index), from the month UI element

createNav.description:
Creates the navigator's containing HTMLElement, it's contents, and appends 
the containg element to the Calendar/CalendarGroup's container.

params.name: cal
params.description: The Calendar instance to update

_update.description: Updates the Calendar rendered state, based on the state of the CalendarNavigator

params.name: e
params.description: The DOM event being handled

_handleDirectionKeys.description:
Default Keyboard event handler to capture up/down/pgup/pgdown
on the Navigator's year control (yearEl).

render.description:
Renders the HTML for the navigator, adding it to the 
document and attaches event listeners if it has not 
already been rendered.

show.description:
Displays the navigator and mask, updating the input controls to reflect the 
currently set month and year. The show method will invoke the render method
if the navigator has not been renderered already, allowing for lazy rendering
of the control.
The show method will fire the Calendar/CalendarGroup's beforeShowNav and showNav events

erase.description:
Removes all renderered HTML elements for the Navigator from
the DOM, purges event listeners and clears (nulls) any property
references to HTML references

params.name: e
params.description: The DOM event being handled

_handleShiftTabKey.description:
Default Keyboard event handler to capture Shift-Tab 
on the first control (firstCtrl) in the Navigator.

cancel.description: Hides the navigator and mask, without updating the Calendar/CalendarGroup's state

applyKeyListeners.description:
Attaches DOM listeners for keyboard support. Tab/Shift-Tab looping, Enter Key Submit on Year element, Up/Down/PgUp/PgDown year increment on Year element

NOTE: MacOSX Safari 2.x doesn't let you tab to buttons and MacOSX Gecko does not let you tab to buttons or select controls, so for these browsers, Tab/Shift-Tab looping is limited to the elements which can be reached using the tab key.

params.name: msg
params.description: The error message to display

setError.description: Displays an error message in the Navigator's error panel

_updateMonthUI.description: Updates the Navigator's month UI, based on the month value set on the Navigator object

hide.description:
Hides the navigator and mask
The show method will fire the Calendar/CalendarGroup's beforeHideNav event and hideNav events

submit.description:
Updates the Calendar/CalendarGroup's pagedate with the currently set month and year if valid.

If the currently set month/year is invalid, a validation error will be displayed and the Calendar/CalendarGroup's pagedate will not be updated.

return.description: A reference to the buffer passed in.

renderNavContents.description: Renders the contents of the navigator
renderNavContents.param: {Array} html The HTML buffer to append the HTML to.

params.name: html
params.description: The HTML buffer to append the HTML to.

params.name: cal
params.description: The instance of the Calendar or CalendarGroup to which this CalendarNavigator should be attached

init.description: Init lifecycle method called as part of construction

setYearError.description: Displays the validation error UI for the year control

return.description:
The year value set in the UI, if valid. null is returned if 
the UI does not contain a valid year value.

_getYearFromUI.description: Returns the year value, from the Navitator's year UI element

_syncMask.description:
Used to set the width/height of the mask in pixels to match the Calendar Container. Currently only used for IE6 or IE in quirks mode. The other A-Grade browser are handled using CSS (width/height 100%).

The method is also registered as an HTMLElement resize listener on the Calendars container element.

return.description: The Navigator's current year value

getYear.description:
Returns the current year set on the navigator
Note: This may not be the year set in the UI, if 
the UI contains an invalid value.

destroy.description: Destroys the Navigator object and any HTML references

return.description: The Navigator's current month index

getMonth.description:
Returns the current month set on the navigator
Note: This may not be the month set in the UI, if 
the UI contains an invalid value.

return.description: The HTML created for the Button UI

renderButton.description: Renders the submit/cancel buttons for the navigator

clearErrors.description: Clears all validation and error messages in the UI

applyListeners.description:
Attaches DOM event listeners to the rendered elements

The method will call applyKeyListeners, to setup keyboard specific listeners

purgeListeners.description: Removes/purges DOM event listeners from the rendered elements

clearYearError.description: Removes the validation error UI for the year control

clearError.description: Clears the navigator's error message and hides the error panel

return.description: true, if the current UI state contains valid values, false if not

validate.description: Validates the current state of the UI controls

params.name: nMonth
params.description: The month index, from 0 (Jan) through 11 (Dec).

setMonth.description: Sets the current month on the Navigator, and updates the UI

_setFirstLastElements.description:
Sets up references to the first and last focusable element in the Navigator's UI in terms of tab order (Naviagator's firstEl and lastEl properties). The references are used to control modality by looping around from the first to the last control and visa versa for tab/shift-tab navigation.

See applyKeyListeners

_show.description:
Protected implementation to handle how UI elements are 
hidden/shown.

setInitialFocus.description: Sets the initial focus, based on the configured value

params.name: e
params.description: The DOM event being handled

_handleEnterKey.description:
Default Keyboard event handler to capture Enter 
on the Navigator's year control (yearEl)

return.description: The value of the configuration property

__getCfg.description:
Retrieve Navigator configuration values from the parent Calendar/CalendarGroup's config value.

If it has not been set in the user provided configuration, the method will return the default value of the configuration property, as set in DEFAULT_CONFIG

params.name: Case
params.description: sensitive property name.

params.name: true,
params.description: if the property is a string property, false if not.

params.name: nYear
params.description: The full year value to set the Navigator to.

setYear.description:
Sets the current year on the Navigator, and updates the UI. If the 
provided year is invalid, it will not be set.

params.name: e
params.description: The DOM event being handled

_handleTabKey.description:
Default Keyboard event handler to capture Tab 
on the last control (lastCtrl) in the Navigator.

createMask.description:
Creates the Mask HTMLElement and appends it to the Calendar/CalendarGroups
container.

purgeKeyListeners.description: Removes/purges DOM listeners for keyboard support

return.description: A reference to the buffer passed in.

params.name: html
params.description: The HTML buffer to append the HTML to.

renderYear.description: Renders the year label and control for the navigator

_updateYearUI.description: Updates the Navigator's year UI, based on the year value set on the Navigator object

_DEFAULT_CFG.description: Object literal containing the default configuration values for the CalendarNavigator
_DEFAULT_CFG.deprecated: Made public. See the public DEFAULT_CONFIG property

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.YR_PATTER.description: Regular expression used to validate the year input

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.UPDATE_DE.description:
Artificial delay (in ms) between the time the Navigator is hidden
and the Calendar/CalendarGroup state is updated. Allows the user
the see the Calendar/CalendarGroup page changing. If set to 0
the Calendar/CalendarGroup page will be updated instantly

lastCtrl.description: Reference to the last focusable control in the navigator (by default cancelEl)

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.MONTH_SUF.description:
The suffix added to the Navigator's ID, to generate
a unique ID for the month control.

errorEl.description: Reference to the HTMLElement used to display validation errors

submitEl.description:
Reference to the HTMLElement used to update the Calendar/Calendar group
with the month/year values

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.ID_SUFFIX.description:
The suffix added to the Calendar/CalendarGroup's ID, to generate
a unique ID for the Navigator and it's bounding box.

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.CLASSES.N.description:
Class applied to the Calendar/CalendarGroup's bounding box to indicate
the Navigator is currently visible

id.description: The unique ID for this CalendarNavigator instance

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.YEAR_SUFF.description:
The suffix added to the Navigator's ID, to generate
a unique ID for the year control.

firstCtrl.description: Reference to the first focusable control in the navigator (by default monthEl)

__isIEQuirks.description: Private flag, to identify IE Quirks

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.TRIM.description: Regular expression used to trim strings

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.CLASSES.M.description: Class applied to the month label/control bounding box

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.YR_MINOR_.description:
The amount by which to increment the current year value,
when the arrow up/down key is pressed on the year control

yearEl.description: Reference to the HTMLElement used to input the year

navEl.description: Reference to the HTMLElement used to render the navigator's bounding box

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.CLASSES.M.description: Class applied to the Navigator mask's bounding box

monthEl.description: Reference to the HTMLElement used to input the month

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.YR_MAJOR_.description:
The amount by which to increment the current year value,
when the page up/down key is pressed on the year control

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.CLASSES.description:
YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.CLASSES contains constants
for the class values applied to the CalendarNaviatgator's 
DOM elements

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.CLASSES.E.description: Class applied to the validation error area's bounding box

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.CLASSES.N.description: Class applied to the Calendar Navigator's bounding box

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.CLASSES.B.description: Class applied to the submit/cancel button's bounding box

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.CLASSES.I.description: Class applied to controls with invalid data (e.g. a year input field with invalid an year)

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.ERROR_SUF.description:
The suffix added to the Navigator's ID, to generate
a unique ID for the error bounding box.

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.CLASSES.B.description: Class applied to buttons wrapping element

YAHOO.widget.CalendarNavigator.CLASSES.Y.description: Class applied to the year input control

_year.description: Internal state property for the current year displayed in the navigator

maskEl.description: Reference to the HTMLElement used to render the navigator's mask

DEFAULT_CONFIG.description:
Object literal containing the default configuration values for the CalendarNavigator The configuration object is expected to follow the format below, with the properties being case sensitive.
strings
Object : An object with the properties shown below, defining the string labels to use in the Navigator's UI
month
String : The string to use for the month label. Defaults to "Month".
year
String : The string to use for the year label. Defaults to "Year".
submit
String : The string to use for the submit button label. Defaults to "Okay".
cancel
String : The string to use for the cancel button label. Defaults to "Cancel".
invalidYear
String : The string to use for invalid year values. Defaults to "Year needs to be a number".
monthFormat

YAHOO.util.History.name: YAHOO.util.History

constructors.description:
The History class provides the ability to use the back/forward navigation
buttons in a DHTML application. It also allows a DHTML application to
be bookmarked in a specific state.

onLoadEvent.description:
Fired when the Browser History Manager is ready. If you subscribe to
this event after the Browser History Manager has been initialized,
it will not fire. Therefore, it is recommended to use the onReady
method instead.

return.description: The current state of the specified module.

getCurrentState.description: Returns the current state of the specified module.

params.name: module
params.description: Non-empty string representing your module.

return.description: true if successful. false otherwise.

_updateIFrame.description: Update the IFrame with our new state.

params.name: fqstate
params.description: Fully qualified state

_handleFQStateChange.description:
Sets the new currentState attribute of all modules depending on the new
fully qualified state. Also notifies the modules which current state has
changed.

params.name: fn
params.description: what to execute when the Browser History Manager is ready.

params.name: obj
params.description: an optional object to be passed back as a parameter to fn.

params.name: overrideContext
params.description: If true, the obj passed in becomes fn's execution scope.

onReady.description:
Executes the supplied callback when the Browser History Manager is
ready. This will execute immediately if called after the Browser
History Manager onLoad event has fired.

return.description: Indicates whether the new state was successfully added to the history.

navigate.description: Call this method when you want to store a new entry in the browser's history.

params.name: module
params.description: Non-empty string representing your module.

params.name: state
params.description: String representing the new state of the specified module.

_initialize.description: Finish up the initialization of the Browser History Manager.

params.name: module
params.description:
Non-empty string uniquely identifying the
module you wish to register.

params.name: initialState
params.description:
The initial state of the specified
module corresponding to its earliest history entry.

params.name: onStateChange
params.description:
Callback called when the
state of the specified module has changed.

params.name: obj
params.description:
An arbitrary object that will be passed as a
parameter to the handler.

params.name: overrideContext
params.description:
If true, the obj passed in becomes the
execution scope of the listener.

_checkIframeLoaded.description: Periodically checks whether our internal IFrame is ready to be used.

return.description: The bookmarked state of the specified module.

getBookmarkedState.description:
Returns the state of a module according to the URL fragment
identifier. This method is useful to initialize your modules
if your application was bookmarked from a particular state.

params.name: module
params.description: Non-empty string representing your module.

params.name: stateField
params.description:
<input type="hidden"> used
to store application states. Must be in the static markup.

params.name: histFrame
params.description:
IFrame used to store
the history (only required on Internet Explorer)

initialize.description:
Initializes the Browser History Manager. Call this method
from a script block located right after the opening body tag.

_storeStates.description:
Stores all the registered modules' initial state and current state.
On Safari, we also store all the fully qualified states visited by
the application within a single browser session. The storage takes
place in the form field specified during initialization.

return.description: The value of the specified parameter, or null.

getQueryStringParameter.description:
Returns the value of the specified query string parameter.
This method is not used internally by the Browser History Manager.
However, it is provided here as a helper since many applications
using the Browser History Manager will want to read the value of
url parameters to initialize themselves.

params.name: paramName
params.description: Name of the parameter we want to look up.

params.name: queryString
params.description:
Optional URL to look at. If not specified,
this method uses the URL in the address bar.

return.description: The hash portion of the document's location

_getHash.description:
location.hash is a bit buggy on Opera. I have seen instances where
navigating the history using the back/forward buttons, and hence
changing the URL, would not change location.hash. That's ok, the
implementation of an equivalent is trivial.

return.description: Indicates whether the new state was successfully added to the history.

multiNavigate.description: Call this method when you want to store a new entry in the browser's history.

params.name: states
params.description: Associative array of module-state pairs to set simultaneously.

_histFrame.description: Our hidden IFrame used to store the browsing history.

_initialized.description: Flag used to tell whether YAHOO.util.History.initialize has been called.

_stateField.description:
INPUT field (with type="hidden" or type="text") or TEXTAREA.
This field keeps the value of the initial state, current state
the list of all states across pages within a single browser session.

_fqstates.description: List of fully qualified states. This is used only by Safari.

YAHOO.util.History.description:
The History class provides the ability to use the back/forward navigation
buttons in a DHTML application. It also allows a DHTML application to
be bookmarked in a specific state.

YAHOO.widget.Tooltip.name: YAHOO.widget.Tooltip

container.description:
Specifies the container element that the Tooltip's markup 
should be rendered into.

width.description: String representing the width of the Tooltip. Please note: As of version 2.3 if either no value or a value of "auto" is specified, and the Toolip's "container" configuration property is set to something other than document.body or its "context" element resides outside the immediately visible portion of the document, the width of the Tooltip will be calculated based on the offsetWidth of its root HTML and set just before it is made visible. The original value will be restored when the Tooltip is hidden. This ensures the Tooltip is rendered at a usable width. For more information see YUILibrary bug #1685496 and YUILibrary bug #1735423.

showdelay.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before showing a Tooltip 
on mouseover.

disabled.description:
Specifies whether or not the tooltip is disabled. Disabled tooltips
will not be displayed. If the tooltip is driven by the title attribute
of the context element, the title attribute will still be removed for 
disabled tooltips, to prevent default tooltip behavior.

preventoverlap.description:
Specifies whether the Tooltip should be kept from overlapping 
its context element.

context.description:
Specifies the element or elements that the Tooltip should be 
anchored to on mouseover.

autodismissdelay.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before automatically 
dismissing a Tooltip after the mouse has been resting on the 
context element.

xyoffset.description:
Specifies the XY offset from the mouse position, where the tooltip should be displayed, specified
as a 2 element array (e.g. [10, 20]);

hidedelay.description:
The number of milliseconds to wait before hiding a Tooltip 
after mouseout.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Tooltip OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Tooltip

params.name: userConfig
params.description:
The configuration object literal containing 
the configuration that should be set for this Overlay. See configuration 
documentation for more details.

constructors.description:
Tooltip is an implementation of Overlay that behaves like an OS tooltip, 
displaying when the user mouses over a particular element, and 
disappearing on mouse out.

params.name: context
params.description: The context element which the user just moused over

params.name: e
params.description: The DOM event object, associated with the mouse over

contextMouseOverEvent.description:
CustomEvent fired when user mouses over a context element. Returning false from
a subscriber to this event will prevent the tooltip from being displayed for
the current context element.

params.name: context
params.description: The context element for which the tooltip is triggered

contextTriggerEvent.description:
CustomEvent fired just before the tooltip is displayed for the current context.

You can subscribe to this event if you need to set up the text for the tooltip based on the context element for which it is about to be displayed.

This event differs from the beforeShow event in following respects:

  1. When moving from one context element to another, if the tooltip is not hidden (the hidedelay is not reached), the beforeShow and Show events will not be fired when the tooltip is displayed for the new context since it is already visible. However the contextTrigger event is always fired before displaying the tooltip for a new context.
  2. The trigger event provides access to the context element, allowing you to set the text of the tooltip based on context element for which the tooltip is triggered.

It is not possible to prevent the tooltip from being displayed using this event. You can use the contextMouseOverEvent if you need to prevent the tooltip from being displayed.

params.name: context
params.description: The context element which the user just moused out of

params.name: e
params.description: The DOM event object, associated with the mouse out

contextMouseOutEvent.description: CustomEvent fired when the user mouses out of a context element.

params.name: e
params.description: The current DOM event

params.name: obj
params.description: The object argument

onContextMouseOver.description:

context element.

String representing the name of the event  
that was fired.

params.name: p_aArgs
params.description:
Array of arguments sent when the event 
was fired.

return.description:
The process ID of the timeout function associated 
with doShow

params.name: e
params.description: The current DOM event

params.name: context
params.description: The current context element

doShow.description:
Processes the showing of the Tooltip by setting the timeout delay 
and offset of the Tooltip.

initEvents.description: Initializes the custom events for Tooltip

element(s) that trigger the display of the tooltip.
